annotations.shortDefinition: Remittance resource
annotations.definition: This resource provides: the claim details; adjudication details from the processing of a Claim; and optionally account balance information, for informing the subscriber of the benefits provided.

annotation.definition: The Response Business Identifier.
Original request resource reference.
Transaction status: error, complete.
A description of the status of the adjudication.
The version of the style of resource contents. This should be mapped to the allowable profiles for this and supporting resources.
The style (standard) and version of the original material which was converted into this resource.
annotation.requirements: Knowledge of the original version can inform the processing of this instance so that information which is processable by the originating system may be generated.

annotation.definition: The date when the enclosed suite of services were performed or completed.
The Insurer who produced this adjudicated response.
The practitioner who is responsible for the services rendered to the patient.
The organization which is responsible for the services rendered to the patient.

search.name: identifier
search.description: The business identifier of the Explanation of Benefit

annotations.shortDefinition: Information about patient's relatives, relevant for patient
annotations.definition: Significant health events and conditions for people related to the subject relevant in the context of care for the subject.

A nested type in FamilyHistory: The significant Conditions (or condition) that the family member had. This is a repeating section to allow a system to represent more than one condition per resource, though there is nothing stopping multiple resources - one per condition.

annotation.definition: The actual condition specified. Could be a coded condition (like MI or Diabetes) or a less specific string like 'cancer' depending on how much is known about the condition and the capabilities of the creating system.
Indicates what happened as a result of this condition. If the condition resulted in death, deceased date is captured on the relation.
Either the age of onset, range of approximate age or descriptive string can be recorded. For conditions with multiple occurrences, this describes the first known occurrence.
annotation.requirements: Age of onset of a condition in relatives is predictive of risk for the patient.
annotation.rimMapping:
inboundRelationship[typeCode=SUBJ].source[classCode=OBS, moodCode=EVN, code="Subject Age at measurement", value<Diagnosis].value[@xsi:typeCode='TS' or 'IVL_TS']
Use originalText for string
annotation.todo: Define/find appropriate observation code.

annotation.definition: An area where general notes can be placed about this specific condition.

annotations.definition: A nested type in FamilyHistory: The related person. Each FamilyHistory resource contains the entire family history for a single person.

annotation.definition: This will either be a name or a description. E.g. "Aunt Susan", "my cousin with the red hair".
annotation.requirements: Allows greater ease in ensuring the same person is being talked about.

annotation.definition: The type of relationship this person has to the patient (father, mother, brother etc.).
The actual or approximate date of birth of the relative.
annotation.requirements: Allows calculation of the relative's age.

annotation.definition: The actual or approximate age of the relative at the time the family history is recorded.
annotation.requirements: While age can be calculated from date of birth, sometimes recording age directly is more natureal for clinicians.

annotation.definition: If this resource is indicating that the related person is deceased, then an indicator of whether the person is deceased (yes) or not (no) or the age or age range or description of age at death - can be indicated here. If the reason for death is known, then it can be indicated in the outcome code of the condition - in this case the deceased property should still be set.
annotation.rimMapping:
player[classCode=LIV, determinerCode=INSTANCE].deceasedInd, deceasedDate (could be URG)
For age, you'd hang an observation off the role

annotation.definition: This property allows a non condition-specific note to the made about the related person. Ideally, the note would be in the condition property, but this is not always possible.

annotation.shortDefinition: Condition that the related person had
annotation.definition: The significant Conditions (or condition) that the family member had. This is a repeating section to allow a system to represent more than one condition per resource, though there is nothing stopping multiple resources - one per condition.
annotation.comment: If none of the conditions listed have an outcome of "death" specified, that indicates that none of the specified conditions are known to have been the primary cause of death.

binding.name: FamilialRelationship
binding.definition: The nature of the relationship between the patient and the related person being described in the family history

binding.name: ConditionOutcome
binding.definition: The result of the condition for the patient. E.g. death, permanent disability, temporary disability, etc.

annotation.definition: This records identifiers associated with this family history record that are defined by business processes and/ or used to refer to it when a direct URL reference to the resource itself is not appropriate (e.g. in CDA documents, or in written / printed documentation).
annotation.requirements: Need to allow connection to a wider workflow.

annotation.definition: The person who this history concerns.
The date (and possibly time) when the family history was taken.
annotation.requirements: Allows determination of how current the summary is.

annotation.definition: Conveys information about family history not specific to individual relations.
The related person. Each FamilyHistory resource contains the entire family history for a single person.

example.name: Father
example.description: Basic Example. Describes the fathers death at age 74 from a heart attack

example.name: Mother
example.description: Mother died from a stroke aged 56. Brother with diabetes.

search.name: patient
search.description: The identity of a subject to list family history items for

search.name: date
search.description: When history was captured/updated

annotations.shortDefinition: Describes the intended objective(s) of patient care
annotations.definition: Describes the intended objective(s) of patient care, for example, weight loss, restoring an activity of daily living, etc.
annotations.comment: Goal can be achieving a particular change or merely maintaining a current state or even slowing a decline.

binding.name: GoalStatus
binding.definition: Indicates whether the goal has been met and is still being targeted

code.definition: A goal is proposed for this patient.
A goal is planned for this patient.
The goal is being sought but has not yet been reached. (Also applies if goal was reached in the past but there has been regression and goal is being sought again).
The goal has been met and no further action is needed.
The goal has been met, but ongoing activity is needed to sustain the goal objective.
The goal is no longer being sought.
A proposed goal was accepted.
A proposed goal was rejected.

annotation.definition: This records identifiers associated with this care plan that are defined by business processed and/ or used to refer to it when a direct URL reference to the resource itself is not appropriate (e.g. in CDA documents, or in written / printed documentation).
annotation.requirements: Need to allow connection to a wider workflow.

annotation.shortDefinition: The patient for whom this goal is intended for
annotation.definition: Identifies the patient/subject whose intended care is described by the plan.
annotation.requirements: Goals are associated with a patient.

annotation.definition: Human-readable description of a specific desired objective of care.
annotation.requirements: Without a description of what's trying to be achieved, element has no purpose.

annotation.shortDefinition: proposed | planned | in-progress | achieved | sustaining | cancelled | accepted | rejected
annotation.definition: Indicates whether the goal has been reached and is still considered relevant.
annotation.requirements: Allows measuring outcome and whether goal needs to be further tracked.
annotation.rimMapping: .statusCode in-progress = active (classCode = OBJ) achieved = complete sustaining = active (classCode=OBJC) cancelled = aborted

annotation.definition: Any comments related to the goal.
annotation.comment: May be used for progress notes, concerns or other related information that doesn't actually describe the goal itself.
annotation.requirements: There's a need to capture information about the goal that doesn't actually describe the goal.

annotation.definition: The identified conditions that this goal relates to - the condition that caused it to be created, or that it is intended to address.
annotation.requirements: Allows specific goals to explicitly linked to conditions - makes the goal more understandable.

search.name: patient
search.description: The patient for whom this goal is intended for

annotations.shortDefinition: Group of multiple entities
annotations.definition: Represents a defined collection of entities that may be discussed or acted upon collectively but which are not expected to act collectively and are not formally or legally recognized. I.e. A collection of entities that isn't an Organization.
annotations.todo: We need determiner codes that indicate we're talking about a group even when we haven't specified a specific quantity.

annotations.definition: A nested type in Group: Identifies the traits shared by members of the group.

annotation.definition: A code that identifies the kind of trait being asserted.
annotation.requirements: Need a formal way of identifying the characteristic being described.

annotation.definition: The value of the trait that holds (or does not hold - see 'exclude') for members of the group.
annotation.comment: For Range, it means members of the group have a value that falls somewhere within the specified range.
annotation.requirements: The value of the characteristic is what determines group membership.

annotation.definition: If true, indicates the characteristic is one that is NOT held by members of the group.
annotation.comment: This is labeled as "Is Modifier" because applications cannot wrongly include excluded members as included or vice versa.
annotation.requirements: Sometimes group membership is determined by characteristics not possessed.

binding.name: GroupType
binding.definition: Types of resources that are part of group

code.definition: Group contains "person" Patient resources.
Group contains "animal" Patient resources.
Group contains healthcare practitioner resources.
Group contains Device resources.
Group contains Medication resources.
Group contains Substance resources.

binding.name: GroupKind
binding.definition: Kind of particular resource. E.g. cow, syringe, lake, etc.

binding.name: GroupCharacteristicKind
binding.definition: List of characteristics used to describe group members. E.g. gender, age, owner, location, etc.

binding.name: GroupCharacteristicValue
binding.definition: Value of descriptive member characteristic. E.g. red, male, pneumonia, caucasian, etc.

annotation.definition: A unique business identifier for this group.
annotation.requirements: Allows the group to be referenced.

annotation.shortDefinition: person | animal | practitioner | device | medication | substance
annotation.definition: Identifies the broad classification of the kind of resources the group includes.
annotation.requirements: Identifies what type of resources the group is made up of.
annotation.rimMapping:
person: ./classCode="PSN"
animal: ./classCode="ANM"
device: ./classCode="DEV"
medication: ./classCode="MMAT" and ./playedRole[isNormalRole() and classCode="THER"]
food: ./classCode="FOOD"
annotation.committeeNotes: Do we need "mixed" groups?

annotation.definition: If true, indicates that the resource refers to a specific group of real individuals. If false, the group defines a set of intended individuals.
annotation.requirements: There are use-cases for groups that define specific collections of individuals, and other groups that define "types" of intended individuals. The requirements for both kinds of groups are similar, so we use a single resource, distinguished by this flag.

annotation.definition: Provides a specific type of resource the group includes. E.g. "cow", "syringe", etc.
annotation.comment: This would generally be omitted for Person resources.

annotation.definition: A label assigned to the group for human identification and communication.
annotation.requirements: Used to identify the group in human communication.

annotation.definition: A count of the number of resource instances that are part of the group.
annotation.requirements: Group size is a common defining characteristic.

annotation.definition: Identifies the traits shared by members of the group.
annotation.requirements: Needs to be a generic mechanism for identifying what individuals can be part of a group.
annotation.rimMapping: ./playedRole[isNormalRole()]/participation[isNormalParticipation() and typeCode="SBJ"]/act[isNormalAct and classCode="OBS" and moodCode="EVN"]

annotation.shortDefinition: Who or what is in group
annotation.definition: Identifies the resource instances that are members of the group.
annotation.requirements: Often the only thing of interest about a group is "who's in it".
annotation.committeeNotes: Is "group of groups" in the 80%?

invariant.name: grp-4
invariant.human: Can't have more members associated with the group than the value specified for "quantity"

invariant.name: grp-1
invariant.human: Can only have members if group is "actual"

search.name: member
search.description: Who or what is in group

search.name: characteristic-value
search.description: A composite of both characteristic and value

search.name: value
search.description: Value held by characteristic

search.name: actual
search.description: Descriptive or actual

search.name: exclude
search.description: Group includes or excludes

search.name: code
search.description: The kind of resources contained

search.name: characteristic
search.description: Kind of characteristic

search.name: type
search.description: The type of resources the group contains

search.name: identifier
search.description: Unique id

annotations.shortDefinition: The details of a Healthcare Service available at a location
annotations.definition: The details of a Healthcare Service available at a location.
A nested type in HealthcareService: A specific type of service that may be delivered or performed.

annotation.shortDefinition: The specific type of service being delivered or performed
annotation.definition: The specific type of service being delivered or performed.
annotation.comment: Change to serviceType?

annotation.shortDefinition: Collection of Specialties handled by the Service Site. This is more of a Medical Term
annotation.definition: Collection of Specialties handled by the Service Site. This is more of a Medical Term.

annotations.definition: A nested type in HealthcareService: A Collection of times that the Service Site is available.

annotation.shortDefinition: Indicates which Days of the week are available between the Start and End Times
annotation.definition: Indicates which Days of the week are available between the Start and End Times.

annotation.shortDefinition: Is this always available? (hence times are irrelevant) e.g. 24 hour service
annotation.definition: Is this always available? (hence times are irrelevant) e.g. 24 hour service.

annotation.shortDefinition: The opening time of day (the date is not included). Note: If the AllDay flag is set, then this time is ignored
annotation.definition: The opening time of day (the date is not included). Note: If the AllDay flag is set, then this time is ignored.

annotation.shortDefinition: The closing time of day (the date is not included). Note: If the AllDay flag is set, then this time is ignored
annotation.definition: The closing time of day (the date is not included). Note: If the AllDay flag is set, then this time is ignored.

annotations.definition: A nested type in HealthcareService: Not avail times - need better description.

annotation.shortDefinition: The reason that can be presented to the user as to why this time is not available
annotation.definition: The reason that can be presented to the user as to why this time is not available.

annotation.shortDefinition: Service is not available (seasonally or for a public holiday) from this date
annotation.definition: Service is not available (seasonally or for a public holiday) from this date.

annotation.shortDefinition: Service is not available (seasonally or for a public holiday) until this date
annotation.definition: Service is not available (seasonally or for a public holiday) until this date.
External Ids for this item.

annotation.shortDefinition: The location where this healthcare service may be provided
annotation.definition: The location where this healthcare service may be provided.

annotation.shortDefinition: Identifies the broad category of service being performed or delivered. Selecting a Service Category then determines the list of relevant service types that can be selected in the Primary Service Type
annotation.definition: Identifies the broad category of service being performed or delivered. Selecting a Service Category then determines the list of relevant service types that can be selected in the Primary Service Type.

annotation.shortDefinition: A specific type of service that may be delivered or performed
annotation.definition: A specific type of service that may be delivered or performed.

annotation.shortDefinition: Further description of the service as it would be presented to a consumer while searching
annotation.definition: Further description of the service as it would be presented to a consumer while searching.

annotation.shortDefinition: Additional description of the or any specific issues not covered by the other attributes, which can be displayed as further detail under the serviceName
annotation.definition: Additional description of the or any specific issues not covered by the other attributes, which can be displayed as further detail under the serviceName.

annotation.shortDefinition: Extra details about the service that can't be placed in the other fields
annotation.definition: Extra details about the service that can't be placed in the other fields.
annotation.comment: Can this just be removed, and extension if needed?

annotation.shortDefinition: The free provision code provides a link to the Free Provision reference entity to enable the selection of one free provision type
annotation.definition: The free provision code provides a link to the Free Provision reference entity to enable the selection of one free provision type.
annotation.comment: Name of this field should be more generic.

annotation.shortDefinition: Does this service have specific eligibility requirements that need to be met in order to use the service
annotation.definition: Does this service have specific eligibility requirements that need to be met in order to use the service.

annotation.shortDefinition: Describes the eligibility conditions for the service
annotation.definition: The description of service eligibility should, in general, not exceed one or two paragraphs. It should be sufficient for a prospective consumer to determine if they are likely to be eligible or not. Where eligibility requirements and conditions are complex, it may simply be noted that an eligibility assessment is required. Where eligibility is determined by an outside source, such as an Act of Parliament, this should be noted, preferably with a reference to a commonly available copy of the source document such as a web page.

annotation.shortDefinition: Indicates whether or not a prospective consumer will require an appointment for a particular service at a Site to be provided by the Organization. Indicates if an appointment is required for access to this service. If this flag is 'NotDefined', then this flag is overridden by the Site's availability flag. (ConditionalIndicator Enum)
annotation.definition: Indicates whether or not a prospective consumer will require an appointment for a particular service at a Site to be provided by the Organization. Indicates if an appointment is required for access to this service. If this flag is 'NotDefined', then this flag is overridden by the Site's availability flag. (ConditionalIndicator Enum).

annotation.shortDefinition: If there is an image associated with this Service Site, its URI can be included here
annotation.definition: If there is an image associated with this Service Site, its URI can be included here.

annotation.shortDefinition: A Collection of times that the Service Site is available
annotation.definition: A Collection of times that the Service Site is available.

annotation.shortDefinition: Not avail times - need better description
annotation.definition: Not avail times - need better description.

annotation.shortDefinition: A description of Site availability exceptions, e.g., public holiday availability. Succinctly describing all possible exceptions to normal Site availability as details in the Available Times and Not Available Times
annotation.definition: A description of Site availability exceptions, e.g., public holiday availability. Succinctly describing all possible exceptions to normal Site availability as details in the Available Times and Not Available Times.
annotation.comment: (May contain HTML formatted text).

annotation.shortDefinition: The public part of the 'keys' allocated to an Organization by an accredited body to support secure exchange of data over the internet. To be provided by the Organization, where available
annotation.definition: The public part of the 'keys' allocated to an Organization by an accredited body to support secure exchange of data over the internet. To be provided by the Organization, where available.
annotation.comment: Note: This is a base64 encoded digital certificate. The ServD Federation's Profile will specify the type of certificate to be used and its purpose.

annotation.shortDefinition: Program Names that can be used to categorize the service
annotation.definition: Program Names that can be used to categorize the service.

annotation.shortDefinition: List of contacts related to this specific healthcare service. If this is empty, then refer to the location's contacts
annotation.definition: List of contacts related to this specific healthcare service. If this is empty, then refer to the location's contacts.
Collection of Characteristics (attributes).
annotation.comment: These could be such things as is wheelchair accessible.

annotation.shortDefinition: Ways that the service accepts referrals
annotation.definition: Ways that the service accepts referrals.

annotation.shortDefinition: The setting where this service can be provided, such is in home, or at location in organisation
annotation.definition: The setting where this service can be provided, such is in home, or at location in organisation.

annotation.shortDefinition: Collection of Target Groups for the Service Site (The target audience that this service is for)
annotation.definition: Collection of Target Groups for the Service Site (The target audience that this service is for).
Need better description.
Need better description.
List of the specific.

search.description: Service Category of the Healthcare Service

search.description: The type of service provided by this healthcare service

annotations.shortDefinition: Key Object Selection
annotations.definition: A set of DICOM SOP Instances of a patient, selected for some application purpose, e.g., quality assurance, teaching, conference, consulting, etc. Objects selected can be from different studies, but must be of the same patient.
annotations.requirements: A FHIR representation of DICOM Key Object Selection (KOS) SOP Instances enables access to a set of selected DICOM SOP Instances.

annotations.definition: A nested type in ImagingObjectSelection: Study identity and locating information of the DICOM SOP instances in the selection.

annotation.definition: Study instance uid of the SOP instances in the selection.
annotation.requirements: Study instance uid is required to fully identify the DICOM SOP instances in the selection.

annotation.definition: WADO-RS URL to retrieve the study. Note that this URL retrieves all SOP instances of the study, not only those in the selection.
annotation.comment: Study level locator information is optional. If provided, this is the URL to retrieve the entire study with WADO-RS interaction, though only a subset of these are selected in the selection.
annotation.requirements: WADO-RS URL enables retrieval of the entire study using DICOM WADO-RS API.

annotation.shortDefinition: Series identity of the selected instances
annotation.definition: Series indetity and locating information of the DICOM SOP instances in the selection.
annotation.comment: Series component represents the series level indentity and locator information of the DICOM SOP instances in the selection.
annotation.requirements: DICOM SOP instances are identified through the UIDs of the study - series - instance hierarchy. In addition, the locator at the series level provide a means of retrieving the entire series.

annotations.definition: A nested type in ImagingObjectSelection: Identity and locating information of the selected DICOM SOP instances.

annotation.definition: SOP class uid of the selected instance.
annotation.comment: SOP class uid provides the type of the selected instances, e.g., CT image, Gray scale softcopy presentation state, ECG waveform, etc.
annotation.requirements: DICOM SOP instance can be an imaging or other data object. The SOP class uid provide the accurate information about what type the instance is.
annotation.committeeNotes: Define proficiency and mode as extensions.

annotation.definition: SOP Instance uid of the selected instance.
annotation.comment: SOP instance uid identifies the instance.
annotation.requirements: SOP instance uid is required to fully identify the DICOM SOP instance in the selection.
annotation.committeeNotes: Rationale for putting this in the core is based on input from Canada. Other persons on call are from single language countries. Committee felt uncomfortable with leaving any of the 3 optional attributes modeCode, proficiencyLevelCode, or preferenceInd up to extensions. Instead we said that isModifier is "no" on modeCode and preferenceInd.

annotation.definition: WADO-RS URL to retrieve the DICOM SOP Instance.
annotation.comment: Instance level locator information is required.
annotation.requirements: WADO-RS URL enables retrieval of the SOP instance using DICOM WADO-RS API.

annotation.definition: Identity and location information of the frames in the selected instance.
annotation.comment: This component may be used if the referenced image SOP Instance is a multi-frame image.
annotation.requirements: The DICOM frames for a given study, series, SOP Instance UID, and frame numbers. The retrieveUrl retrieves the pixel data, and is encapsulated in a multipart MIME response.

annotations.definition: A nested type in ImagingObjectSelection: Series indetity and locating information of the DICOM SOP instances in the selection.

annotation.definition: Series instance uid of the SOP instances in the selection.
annotation.requirements: Series instance uid is required to fully identify the DICOM SOP instances in the selection.

annotation.definition: WADO-RS URL to retrieve the series Note that this URL retrieves all SOP instances of the series not only those in the selection.
annotation.comment: Series level locator information is optional. If provided, this is the URL to retrieve the entire series with WADO-RS interaction, though only a subset of these are selected in the selection.
annotation.requirements: WADO-RS URL enables retrieval of the entire series using DICOM WADO-RS API.

annotation.definition: Identity and locating information of the selected DICOM SOP instances.
annotation.comment: SOP Instance component identify the instance selected in the selection, along with the study and series identities to form the DICOM identity hierachy.
annotation.requirements: DICOM SOP instances are identified through the UIDs of the study - series - instance hierarchy. This is the instance level identity of the instance in the selection.

annotations.definition: A nested type in ImagingObjectSelection: Identity and location information of the frames in the selected instance.

annotation.definition: The frame numbers in the frame set.
annotation.requirements: one or more non duplicate frame numbers.

annotation.definition: WADO-RS URL to retrieve the DICOM frames.
annotation.comment: Frame level locator information is required.
annotation.requirements: WADO-RS URL enables retrieval of the frames using DICOM WADO-RS API.

binding.name: KOStitle
binding.definition: The document title code of key object selection

code.definition: Of Interest.
Rejected for Quality Reasons.
For Referring Provider.
For Surgery.
For Teaching.
For Conference.
For Therapy.
For Patient.
For Peer Review.
For Research.
Quality Issue.
Best In Set.
For Printing.
For Report Attachment.
For Litigation.
Signed Manifest.
Complete Study Content.
Signed Complete Study Content.
Complete Acquisition Content.
Signed Complete Acquisition Content.
Group of Frames for Display.
Rejected for Patient Safety Reasons.
Incorrect Modality Worklist Entry.
Data Retention Policy Expired.

annotation.definition: Instance UID of the DICOM KOS SOP Instances represenetd in this resource.
annotation.requirements: DICOM SOP Instance is always assigned with a unique identifier (UID).

annotation.definition: A patient resource reference which is the patient subject of all DICOM SOP Instances in this key object selection.
annotation.comment: SOP instances selected in the key object selection can be from different studies, but must be of the same patient.
annotation.requirements: SOP Instances in key object selection must be from the same patient.

annotation.definition: The reason for, or significance of, the selection of objects referenced in the resource.
annotation.comment:
Coded concept of kind of the key object selection. Value set is defined in the DICOM standard CID-7010.
http://medical.nema.org/medical/dicom/current/output/chtml/part16/sect_CID_7010.html.
annotation.requirements: Need to represent the application purpose that the SOP instances in key object selection are selected for.

annotation.definition: Text description of the DICOM SOP instances selected in the key object selection. This should be aligned with the content of the title element, and can provide further explanation of the SOP instances in the selection.
annotation.comment: Free text narrative description of the key object selection.
annotation.requirements: Need to provide a narrative description of the SOP instances in the selection.

annotation.definition: Author of key object selection. It can be a human authtor or a device which made the decision of the SOP instances selected. For example, a radiologist selected a set of imaging SOP instances to attached in a diagnostic report, and a CAD application may author a selection to describe SOP instances it used to generate a detection conclusion.
annotation.comment: Author of the key object selection. This can be a human author or a device author. Human author is represented with the HumanName type. Device author is represented with a reference to the Device resource.
annotation.requirements: Track the selection decision maker.

annotation.definition: Date and time when the key object selection was authored. Note that this is the date and time the DICOM SOP instances in the selection were selected (selection decision making). It is different from the creation date and time of the selection resource.
annotation.comment: Authoring time.
annotation.requirements: Date and time when the selection was made can be important to understand the content of selection.

annotation.shortDefinition: Study identity of the selected instances
annotation.definition: Study identity and locating information of the DICOM SOP instances in the selection.
annotation.comment: Study component represents the study level identity and locator information of the DICOM SOP instances in the selection. It is the top level identity of the hierachical identification of the instances.
annotation.requirements: DICOM SOP instances are identified through the UIDs of the study - series - instance hierarchy. In addition, the locator at the study level provide a means of retrieving the entire study.

search.name: selected-study
search.description: Study selected in key DICOM object selection

search.name: author
search.description: Author of key DICOM object selection

search.name: title
search.description: Title of key DICOM object selection

search.name: patient
search.description: Subject of key DICOM object selection

search.name: authoring-time
search.description: Time of key DICOM object selection authoring

search.name: identifier
search.description: UID of key DICOM object selection

annotations.shortDefinition: A set of images produced in single study (one or more series of references images)
annotations.definition: Representation of the content produced in a DICOM imaging study. A study comprises a set of Series, each of which includes a set of Service-Object Pair Instances (SOP Instances - images or other data) acquired or produced in a common context. A Series is of only one modality (e.g., X-ray, CT, MR, ultrasound), but a Study may have multiple Series of different modalities.
A nested type in ImagingStudy: Each study has one or more series of image instances.

annotation.definition: The Numeric identifier of this series in the study.

annotation.shortDefinition: The modality of the instances in the series (0008,0060)
annotation.definition: The modality of this series sequence.
Formal identifier for this series.
A description of the series.
Number of SOP Instances in Series.
Availability of series (online, offline or nearline).
WADO-RS resource where the Series is available.
Body part examined. See DICOM Part 16 Annex L for the mapping from DICOM to Snomed.
Laterality if bodySite is paired anatomic structure and laterality is not pre-coordinated in bodySite code, map from (0020, 0060).
The date and time when the series was started.

annotation.shortDefinition: A single instance taken from a patient (image or other)
annotation.definition: A single SOP Instance within the series, e.g., an image, or presentation state.

annotations.definition: A nested type in ImagingStudy: A single SOP Instance within the series, e.g., an image, or presentation state.

annotation.shortDefinition: The number of this instance in the series (0020,0013)
annotation.definition: The number of this image in the series.
Formal identifier for this image.
DICOM Image type.
A human-friendly SOP Class name.
annotation.comment: E.g., 'CT image', 'MR multi-frame', 'blending presentation'.

annotation.definition: The description of the instance.
annotation.comment: Particularly for post-acquisition analytic objects, such as SR, presentation states, value mapping, etc.

annotation.definition: Content of the instance or a rendering thereof (e.g., a JPEG of an image, or an XML of a structured report). May be represented by inline encoding, or by a URL reference to a WADO-RS service that makes the instance available. Multiple content attachments may be used for alternate representations of the instance.
annotation.comment: Each instance may have a url and an attachment. Both represent the same information, but using different approaches. The attachment is a reference to a FHIR resource (Media, Document, etc).

binding.name: ImagingModality

annotations.shortDefinition: Information summarized from a list of other resources
annotations.definition: A set of information summarized from a list of other resources.
annotations.todo:
RIM harmonization proposal to move LIST under GROUPER
RIM harmonization proposal to allow organizers to group roles as well as acts.

annotations.definition: A nested type in List: Entries in this list.

annotation.definition: The flag allows the system constructing the list to make one or more statements about the role and significance of the item in the list.
annotation.comment: The flag can only be understood in the context of the List.code. If the flag means that the entry has actually been deleted from the list, the deleted element SHALL be true. Deleted can only be used if the List.mode is "changes".
annotation.requirements: This field is present to support various clinical uses of lists, such as a discharge summary medication list, where flags specify whether the medication was added, modified, or deleted from the list.

annotation.shortDefinition: If this item is actually marked as deleted
annotation.definition: True if this item is marked as deleted in the list.
annotation.comment: If the flag means that the entry has actually been deleted from the list, the deleted element SHALL be true. Both flag and deleted can only be used if the List.mode is "changes". A deleted entry should be displayed in narrative as deleted.
annotation.requirements: The flag element may contain codes that an application processing the list does not understand. However there can be no ambiguity if a list item is actually marked as "deleted".

annotation.definition: When this item was added to the list.
annotation.comment: This is only useful and meaningful when the mode is "working".
annotation.requirements: The date may be significant for understanding the meaning of items in a working list.

annotation.definition: A reference to the actual resource from which data was derived.

binding.name: ListOrder
binding.definition: What order applies to the items in a list

binding.name: ListMode
binding.definition: The processing mode that applies to this list

code.definition: This list is the master list, maintained in an ongoing fashion with regular updates as the real world list it is tracking changes.
This list was prepared as a snapshot. It should not be assumed to be current.
The list is prepared as a statement of changes that have been made or recommended.

binding.name: ListItemFlag
binding.definition: Codes that provide further information about the reason and meaning of the item in the list

binding.name: ListPurpose
binding.definition: What the purpose of a list is

binding.name: ListEmptyReason
binding.definition: If a list is empty, why it is empty

annotation.definition: Identifier for the List assigned for business purposes outside the context of FHIR.

annotation.shortDefinition: What the purpose of this list is
annotation.definition: This code defines the purpose of the list - why it was created.
annotation.comment: If there is no code, the purpose of the list is implied where it is used, such as in a document section using Document.section.code.
annotation.requirements: Lists often contain subsets of resources rather than an exhaustive list. The code identifies what type of subset is included.

annotation.shortDefinition: If all resources have the same subject
annotation.definition: The common subject (or patient) of the resources that are in the list, if there is one.
annotation.comment: Some purely aribitrary lists do not have a common subject, so this is optional.
annotation.requirements: The primary purpose of listing the subject explicitly is to help with finding the right list.

annotation.shortDefinition: Who and/or what defined the list contents
annotation.definition: The entity responsible for deciding what the contents of the list were.
annotation.comment: The primary source is the entity that made the decisions what items are in the list. This may be software or user.
annotation.requirements: Allows follow-up as well as context.

annotation.definition: The date that the list was prepared.
annotation.comment: The actual important date is the date of currency of the resources that were summarized, but it is usually assumed that these are current when the preparation occurs.
annotation.requirements: Identifies how current the list is which affects relevance.

annotation.definition: What order applies to the items in the list.
annotation.comment: Applications SHOULD render ordered lists in the order provided, but MAY allow users to re-order based on their own preferences as well. If there is no order specified, the order is unknown, though there may still be some order.
annotation.requirements: Important for presentation and rendering. Lists may be sorted to place more important information first or to group related entries.

annotation.definition: How this list was prepared - whether it is a working list that is suitable for being maintained on an ongoing basis, or if it represents a snapshot of a list of items from another source, or whether it is a prepared list where items may be marked as added, modified or deleted.
annotation.requirements: Lists are used in various ways, and it must be known in what way it is safe to use them.

annotation.definition: Entries in this list.
annotation.comment: If there are no entries in the list, an emptyReason SHOULD be provided.

annotation.definition: If the list is empty, why the list is empty.
annotation.comment: The various reasons for an empty list make a significant interpretation to its interpretation.
annotation.requirements: Allows capturing things like "none exist" or "not asked" which can be important for most lists.

invariant.name: lst-2
invariant.human: The deleted flag can only be used if the mode of the list is "changes"

invariant.name: lst-1
invariant.description: No emptyReason if list is not empty
invariant.human: A list can only have an emptyReason if it is empty

search.name: patient
search.description: If all resources have the same subject

search.name: source
search.description: Who and/or what defined the list contents

search.name: subject
search.description: If all resources have the same subject

search.name: item
search.description: Actual entry

search.name: code
search.description: What the purpose of this list is

search.name: date
search.description: When the list was prepared

search.name: empty-reason
search.description: Why list is empty

annotations.shortDefinition: Details and position information for a physical place
annotations.definition: Details and position information for a physical place where services are provided and resources and participants may be stored, found, contained or accommodated.
A nested type in Location: The absolute geographic location of the Location, expressed in with the WGS84 datum (This is the same co-ordinate system used in KML).

annotation.definition: Longitude. The value domain and the interpretation are the same as for the text of the longitude element in KML (see notes below).
annotation.rimMapping: ?? RIM Opted not to map the sub-elements of GPS location) is now an OBS

annotation.definition: Latitude. The value domain and the interpretation are the same as for the text of the latitude element in KML (see notes below).
annotation.rimMapping: ?? RIM Opted not to map the sub-elements of GPS location) is now an OBS

annotation.definition: Altitude. The value domain and the interpretation are the same as for the text of the altitude element in KML (see notes below).
annotation.rimMapping: ?? RIM Opted not to map the sub-elements of GPS location) is now an OBS

binding.name: LocationStatus
binding.definition: Indicates whether the location is still in use

code.definition: The location is operational.
The location is temporarily closed.
The location is no longer used.

binding.name: LocationType
binding.definition: Indicates the type of function performed at the location

binding.name: LocationMode
binding.definition: Indicates whether a resource instance represents a specific location or a class of locations

code.definition: The Location resource represents a specific instance of a Location.
The Location represents a class of Locations.

binding.name: PhysicalType
binding.definition: Physical form of the location

annotation.shortDefinition: Unique code or number identifying the location to its users
annotation.definition: Unique code or number identifying the location to its users.
annotation.requirements: Organization label locations in registries, need to keep track of those.

annotation.shortDefinition: Name of the location as used by humans
annotation.definition: Name of the location as used by humans. Does not need to be unique.

annotation.shortDefinition: Description of the Location, which helps in finding or referencing the place
annotation.definition: Description of the Location, which helps in finding or referencing the place.
annotation.requirements: Humans need additional information to verify a correct location has been identified.

annotation.shortDefinition: Indicates the type of function performed at the location
annotation.definition: Indicates the type of function performed at the location.
The contact details of communication devices available at the location. This can include phone numbers, fax numbers, mobile numbers, email addresses and web sites.
Physical location.
annotation.comment: This was kept as 0..1 as there is no use property on the address, so wouldn't be able to identify different address types.
annotation.requirements: If locations can be visited, we need to keep track of their address.

annotation.definition: Physical form of the location, e.g. building, room, vehicle, road.
annotation.requirements: For purposes of showing relevant locations in queries, we need to categorize locations.

annotation.definition: The absolute geographic location of the Location, expressed in with the WGS84 datum (This is the same co-ordinate system used in KML).
annotation.requirements: For mobile applications and automated route-finding knowing the exact location of the Location is required.

annotation.shortDefinition: The organization that is responsible for the provisioning and upkeep of the location
annotation.definition: The organization that is responsible for the provisioning and upkeep of the location.
annotation.requirements: Need to know who manages the location.

annotation.definition: active | suspended | inactive.

annotation.shortDefinition: Another Location which this Location is physically part of
annotation.definition: Another Location which this Location is physically part of.
annotation.requirements: For purposes of location, display and identification, knowing which locations are located within other locations is important.

annotation.definition: Indicates whether a resource instance represents a specific location or a class of locations.
annotation.requirements: When using a Location resource for scheduling or orders, we need to be able to refer to a class of Locations instead of a specific Location.

search.name: organization
search.description: Searches for locations that are managed by the provided organization

search.name: near
search.description: The coordinates expressed as [lat],[long] (using KML, see notes) to find locations near to (servers may search using a square rather than a circle for efficiency)

search.name: partof
search.description: The location of which this location is a part

search.name: status
search.description: Searches for locations with a specific kind of status

search.name: address
search.description: A (part of the) address of the location

search.name: name
search.description: A (portion of the) name of the location

search.name: near-distance
search.description: A distance quantity to limit the near search to locations within a specific distance

search.name: type
search.description: A code for the type of location

search.name: identifier
search.description: Unique code or number identifying the location to its users

annotations.shortDefinition: A photo, video, or audio recording acquired or used in healthcare. The actual content may be inline or provided by direct reference
annotations.definition: A photo, video, or audio recording acquired or used in healthcare. The actual content may be inline or provided by direct reference.

binding.name: DigitalMediaType
binding.definition: Whether the Media is a photo, video, or audio

code.definition: The media consists of one or more unmoving images, including photographs, computer-generated graphs and charts, and scanned documents.
The media consists of a series of frames that capture a moving image.
The media consists of a sound recording.

binding.name: DigitalMediaSubtype
binding.definition: Detailed information about the type of the image - its kind, purpose, or the kind of equipment used to generate it

binding.name: MediaView
binding.definition: Imaging view (projection) used when collecting an image

annotation.definition: Whether the media is a photo (still image), an audio recording, or a video recording.
Details of the type of the media - usually, how it was acquired (what type of device). If images sourced from a DICOM system, are wrapped in a Media resource, then this is the modality.

Identifiers associated with the image - these may include identifiers for the image itself, identifiers for the context of its collection (e.g. series ids) and context ids such as accession numbers or other workflow identifiers.
annotation.comment: The identifier label and use can be used to determine what kind of identifier it is.

annotation.shortDefinition: Who/What this Media is a record of
annotation.definition: Who/What this Media is a record of.

annotation.shortDefinition: The person who generated the image
annotation.definition: The person who administered the collection of the image.

annotation.shortDefinition: Imaging view e.g Lateral or Antero-posterior
annotation.definition: The name of the imaging view e.g Lateral or Antero-posterior (AP).
The name of the device / manufacturer of the device that was used to make the recording.

annotation.shortDefinition: Height of the image in pixels(photo/video)
annotation.definition: Height of the image in pixels(photo/video).

annotation.shortDefinition: Width of the image in pixels (photo/video)
annotation.definition: Width of the image in pixels (photo/video).

The number of frames in a photo. This is used with a multi-page fax, or an imaging acquisition context that takes multiple slices in a single image, or an animated gif. If there is more than one frame, this SHALL have a value in order to alert interface software that a multi-frame capable rendering widget is required.
The duration of the recording in seconds - for audio and video.
The actual content of the media - inline or by direct reference to the media source file.
annotation.comment:
Recommended content types: image/jpeg, image/png, image/tiff, video/mpeg, audio/mp4, application/dicom. Application/dicom can contain the transfer syntax as a parameter.
For an media that covers a period of time (video/sound), the content.creationTime is the end time. Creation time is used for tracking, organizing versions and searching.

invariant.name: mda-4
invariant.human: Length can only be used for an audio or a video

invariant.name: mda-3

annotations.shortDefinition: Definition of a Medication

annotation.definition: Identifies one of the items in the package.

annotation.shortDefinition: How many are in the package?
annotation.definition: The amount of the product that is in the package.

annotations.definition: A nested type in Medication: Information that only applies to packages (not products).

annotation.definition: The kind of container that this package comes as.
A set of components that go to make up the described item.

annotations.definition: A nested type in Medication: Identifies a particular constituent of interest in the product.

annotation.definition: The actual ingredient - either a substance (simple ingredient) or another medication.
annotation.v2Mapping: if substance: RXC-2-Component Code if medication: RXO-1-Requested Give Code / RXE-2-Give Code / RXD-2-Dispense/Give Code / RXG-4-Give Code / RXA-5-Administered Code

annotation.definition: Specifies how many (or how much) of the items there are in this Medication. E.g. 250 mg per tablet.
annotation.v2Mapping: if substance: RXC-3-Component Amount & RXC-4-Component Units if medication: RXO-2-Requested Give Amount - Minimum & RXO-4-Requested Give Units / RXO-3-Requested Give Amount - Maximum & RXO-4-Requested Give Units / RXO-11-Requested Dispense Amount & RXO-12-Requested Dispense Units / RXE-3-Give Amount - Minimum & RXE-5-Give Units / RXE-4-Give Amount - Maximum & RXE-5-Give Units / RXE-10-Dispense Amount & RXE-10-Dispense Units

annotations.definition: A nested type in Medication: Information that only applies to products (not packages).

annotation.definition: Describes the form of the item. Powder; tables; carton.
annotation.v2Mapping: RXO-5-Requested Dosage Form / RXE-6-Give Dosage Form / RXD-6-Actual Dosage Form / RXG-8-Give Dosage Form / RXA-8-Administered Dosage Form

annotation.definition: Identifies a particular constituent of interest in the product.
annotation.comment: The ingredients need not be a complete list; usually only active ingredients are listed.
annotation.todo: Should have an indicator distinguishing active & inactive.

annotation.definition: Information about a group of medication produced or packaged from one production run.

annotations.definition: A nested type in Medication: Information about a group of medication produced or packaged from one production run.

annotation.definition: The assigned lot number of a batch of the specified product.
When this specific batch of product will expire.

binding.name: MedicationFormalRepresentation

binding.name: MedicationContainer

binding.name: MedicationKind

code.definition: The medication is a product.
The medication is a package - a contained group of one of more products.

binding.name: MedicationForm
binding.definition: The form of a medication

annotation.definition: The common/commercial name of the medication absent information such as strength, form, etc. E.g. Acetaminophen, Tylenol 3, etc. The fully coordinated name is communicated as the display of Medication.code.
annotation.v2Mapping: RXO-1.2-Requested Give Code.text / RXE-2.2-Give Code.text / RXD-2.2-Dispense/Give Code.text / RXG-4.2-Give Code.text / RXA-5.2-Administered Code.text

annotation.definition: A code (or set of codes) that identify this medication. Usage note: This could be a standard drug code such as a drug regulator code, RxNorm code, SNOMED CT code, etc. It could also be a local formulary code, optionally with translations to the standard drug codes.
annotation.comment: When defining a medication, the code is the "identifying" code for the medication. All the codings provided should be at the same level in the hierarchy (generic, formulation, generic strength, etc.). Codes that relate the medication across the hierarchy should be conveyed using the relationships inherent in Medication.package and Medication.product.
annotation.v2Mapping: RXO-1.1-Requested Give Code.code / RXE-2.1-Give Code.code / RXD-2.1-Dispense/Give Code.code / RXG-4.1-Give Code.code /RXA-5.1-Administered Code.code

annotation.definition: Set to true if the item is attributable to a specific manufacturer (even if we don't know who that is).
Describes the details of the manufacturer.

annotation.definition: Medications are either a single administrable product or a package that contains one or more products.
Information that only applies to products (not packages).
Information that only applies to packages (not products).

annotations.shortDefinition: Administration of medication to a patient
annotations.definition: Describes the event of a patient consuming or otherwise being administered a medication. This may be as simple as swallowing a tablet or it may be a long running infusion. Related resources tie this event to the authorizing prescription, and the specific encounter between patient and health care practitioner.
A nested type in MedicationAdministration: Indicates how the medication is/was used by the patient.

annotation.definition: Free text dosage instructions can be used for cases where the instructions are too complex to code. When coded instructions are present, the free text instructions may still be present for display to humans taking or administering the medication.
A coded specification of the anatomic site where the medication first entered the body. E.g. "left arm".
A code specifying the route or physiological path of administration of a therapeutic agent into or onto the patient. E.g. topical, intravenous, etc.

A coded value indicating the method by which the medication was introduced into or onto the body. Most commonly used for injections. Examples: Slow Push; Deep IV. Terminologies used often pre-coordinate this term with the route and or form of administration.
The amount of the medication given at one administration event. Use this value when the administration is essentially an instantaneous event such as a swallowing a tablet or giving an injection.
annotation.comment: If the administration is not instantaneous (rate is present or timing has a duration), this can be specified to convey the total amount administered over period of time of a single administration (as indicated by schedule).
annotation.v2Mapping: RXA-6-Administered Amount / RXA-7.1-Administered Units.code / RXA-7.3-Administered Units.name of coding system (uri<->code system mapping required)

annotation.shortDefinition: Dose quantity per unit of time
annotation.definition: Identifies the speed with which the medication was introduced into the patient. Typically the rate for an infusion e.g. 200ml in 2 hours. May also expressed as a rate per unit of time such as 100ml per hour - the duration is then not specified, or is specified in the quantity.
annotation.comment: If the rate changes over time, each change should be captured as a distinct "dosage" repetition. This element should *not* be used to convey an average rate.

binding.name: MedicationAdministrationStatus
binding.definition: A set of codes indicating the current status of a MedicationAdministration

code.definition: The administration has started but has not yet completed.
Actions implied by the administration have been temporarily halted, but are expected to continue later. May also be called "suspended".
All actions that are implied by the administration have occurred.
The administration was entered in error and therefore nullified.
Actions implied by the administration have been permanently halted, before all of them occurred.

binding.name: MedicationAdministrationReason
binding.definition: A set of codes indicating the reason why the MedicationAdministration was made.

binding.name: MedicationAdministrationNegationReason
binding.definition: A set of codes indicating the reason why the MedicationAdministration is negated.

annotation.definition: External identifier - FHIR will generate its own internal IDs (probably URLs) which do not need to be explicitly managed by the resource. The identifier here is one that would be used by another non-FHIR system - for example an automated medication pump would provide a record each time it operated; an administration while the patient was off the ward might be made with a different system and entered after the event. Particularly important if these records have to be updated.
annotation.v2Mapping: RXA-25-Administered Barcode Identifier? (V2 def'n of RXA-25 refers to the 'give' occurrence; appears not to discuss 'administer' cardinality which would seem to be 0..*)

annotation.definition: Will generally be set to show that the administration has been completed. For some long running administrations such as infusions it is possible for an administration to be started but not completed or it may be paused while some other process is under way.
The person or animal to whom the medication was given.
The individual who was responsible for giving the medication to the patient.
annotation.v2Mapping: RXA-10-Administering Provider / PRT-5-Participation Person: PRT-4-Participation='AP' (RXA-10 is deprecated)

annotation.definition: The visit or admission the or other contact between patient and health care provider the medication administration was performed as part of.
The original request, instruction or authority to perform the administration.
annotation.v2Mapping: ORC-3-Filler Order Number / ORC-2-Placer Order Number

annotation.definition: Set this to true if the record is saying that the medication was NOT administered.
A code indicating why the administration was not performed.
A code indicating why the medication was given.

annotation.shortDefinition: Start and end time of administration
annotation.definition: An interval of time during which the administration took place (or did not take place, when the 'notGiven' attribute is true). For many administrations, such as swallowing a tablet the use of dateTime is more appropriate.
annotation.v2Mapping: RXA-3-Date/Time Start of Administration / RXA-4-Date/Time End of Administration
annotation.committeeNotes: 2014-0917 HG: Chjanged name from whenGiven to effectiveTime and made datatype choice of period or dataTime.

annotation.definition: Identifies the medication that was administered. This is either a link to a resource representing the details of the medication or a simple attribute carrying a code that identifies the medication from a known list of medications.
annotation.comment: Note: do not use Medication.name to describe the administered medication. When the only available information is a text description of the medication, Medication.code.text should be used.

annotation.definition: The device used in administering the medication to the patient. E.g. a particular infusion pump.
Extra information about the medication administration that is not conveyed by the other attributes.

annotation.shortDefinition: Details of how medication was taken
annotation.definition: Indicates how the medication is/was used by the patient.
annotation.todo: The RMIM has priority code on the act relationship. How do we handle this?

annotations.shortDefinition: Dispensing a medication to a named patient
annotations.definition: Dispensing a medication to a named patient. This includes a description of the supply provided and the instructions for administering the medication.

A nested type in MedicationDispense: Indicates whether or not substitution was made as part of the dispense. In some cases substitution will be expected but doesn't happen, in other cases substitution is not expected but does happen. This block explains what substitition did or did not happen and why.

annotation.definition: A code signifying whether a different drug was dispensed from what was prescribed.
annotation.committeeNotes: No substitution made or expected Subtitution made but not expected Substitution expected but not made Substitution made and expected.

annotation.definition: Indicates the reason for the substitution of (or lack of substitution) from what was prescribed.

annotation.shortDefinition: Who is responsible for the substitution
annotation.definition: The person or organization that has primary responsibility for the substitution.
annotation.committeeNotes: Who is this handled? Elsewhere attribution is handled by FHIR.

annotations.definition: A nested type in MedicationDispense: Indicates how the medication is to be used by the patient.

annotation.definition: Additional instructions such as "Swallow with plenty of water" which may or may not be coded.

The timing schedule for giving the medication to the patient. The Schedule data type allows many different expressions, for example. "Every 8 hours"; "Three times a day"; "1/2 an hour before breakfast for 10 days from 23-Dec 2011:"; "15 Oct 2013, 17 Oct 2013 and 1 Nov 2013".

If set to true or if specified as a CodeableConcept, indicates that the medication is only taken when needed within the specified schedule rather than at every scheduled dose. If a CodeableConcept is present, it indicates the pre-condition for taking the Medication.
annotation.rimMapping: boolean: .outboundRelationship[typeCode=PRCN].negationInd (inversed - so negationInd = true means asNeeded=false CodeableConcept: .outboundRelationship[typCode=PRCN].target[classCode=OBS, moodCode=EVN, isCriterionInd=true, code="Assertion"].value

annotation.definition: A coded specification of the anatomic site where the medication first enters the body.
A code specifying the route or physiological path of administration of a therapeutic agent into or onto a subject.

A coded value indicating the method by which the medication is introduced into or onto the body. Most commonly used for injections. Examples: Slow Push; Deep IV. Terminologies used often pre-coordinate this term with the route and or form of administration.
The amount of therapeutic or other substance given at one administration event.
annotation.comment: Note that this specifies the quantity of the specified medication, not the quantity of active ingredient(s). The prescribed strength can be calculated by multiplying the doseQuantity by the strength of each active ingredient in the prescribed Medication. If the administration is not intended to be instantaneous (rate is present or timing has a duration), this can be specified to convey the total amount to be administered over the period of time as indicated by the schedule.
annotation.v2Mapping: RXE-23-Give Rate Amount / RXE-24.1-Give Rate Units.code / RXE-24.3-Give Rate Units.name of coding system

annotation.shortDefinition: Amount of medication per unit of time
annotation.definition: Identifies the speed with which the substance is introduced into the subject. Typically the rate for an infusion. 200ml in 2 hours.
annotation.comment: It is possible to supply both a rate and a doseQuantity to provide full details about how the medication is to be administered and supplied. If the rate is intended to change over time, each change should be captured as a distinct "dosage" repetition, except for titration orders.

annotation.shortDefinition: Upper limit on medication per unit of time
annotation.definition: The maximum total quantity of a therapeutic substance that may be administered to a subject over the period of time, e.g. 1000mg in 24 hours.

binding.name: MedicationDispenseStatus
binding.description: Describes the lifecycle of the dispense.
binding.definition: A code specifying the state of the dispense event.

code.definition: The dispense has started but has not yet completed.
Actions implied by the administration have been temporarily halted, but are expected to continue later. May also be called "suspended".
All actions that are implied by the dispense have occurred.
The dispense was entered in error and therefore nullified.
Actions implied by the dispense have been permanently halted, before all of them occurred.

binding.name: MedicationDispenseType
binding.definition: Indicates the type of dispensing event that is performed. Examples include: Trial Fill, Completion of Trial, Partial Fill, Emergency Fill, Samples, etc.

annotation.definition: Identifier assigned by the dispensing facility - this is an identifier assigned outside FHIR.
A code specifying the state of the set of dispense events.
annotation.v2Mapping: (Not clear whether or how V2 provides for a snapshot of dispense status)
annotation.committeeNotes: Active - processed but not pickup Completed - process and pickup Aborted - process and put back in stock This is not related to partialFill whioch is really a partialFulfillment of the order.

annotation.definition: A link to a resource representing the person to whom the medication will be given.
annotation.todo: Why is patient optional? Can this be used for non-patient med tranfers?

annotation.definition: The individual responsible for dispensing the medication.
annotation.v2Mapping: RXD-10-Dispensing Provider / PRT-5-Participation Person: PRT-4-Participation='DP' (RXD-10 is deprecated)

annotation.shortDefinition: Medication order that authorizes the dispense
annotation.definition: Indicates the medication order that is being dispensed against.
annotation.v2Mapping: ORC-3-Filler Order Number / ORC-2-Placer Order Number

annotation.shortDefinition: Trial fill, partial fill, emergency fill, etc.
annotation.definition: Indicates the type of dispensing event that is performed. Examples include: Trial Fill, Completion of Trial, Partial Fill, Emergency Fill, Samples, etc.
The amount of medication that has been dispensed. Includes unit of measure.
annotation.v2Mapping: RXD-4-Actual Dispense Amount / RXD-5.1-Actual Dispense Units.code / RXD-5.3-Actual Dispense Units.name of coding system

annotation.definition: The amount of medication expressed as a timing amount.

Identifies the medication being administered. This is either a link to a resource representing the details of the medication or a simple attribute carrying a code that identifies the medication from a known list of medications.
annotation.comment: Note: do not use Medication.name to describe the dispensed medication. When the only available information is a text description of the medication, Medication.code.text should be used.

annotation.definition: The time when the dispensed product was packaged and reviewed.
annotation.committeeNotes: This is time of dispense (preparation). The time of supply to the patient is a separate attribute.

annotation.definition: The time the dispensed product was provided to the patient or their representative.
annotation.committeeNotes: The time of supply to the patient (pickup/handover in community or supply in inpatient).

annotation.definition: Identification of the facility/location where the medication was shipped to, as part of the dispense event.
annotation.v2Mapping: RXD-13-Dispense-to Location; RXD-30-Dispense to Pharmacy; RXD-31-Dispense to Pharmacy Address (V2 (in definition of RXD-13, RXD-30 and RXD-31) directs use of the PRT segment but there doesn't appear to be a standard code in Table 0912 suitable for PRT-4-Participation)
annotation.committeeNotes: for inpatient setting this is core, but this may not be core for community setting. Also core for internet pharmacy. Core for radioactive materials Will service delivery location be defined by another group?

annotation.definition: Identifies the person who picked up the medication. This will usually be a patient or their carer, but some cases exist where it can be a healthcare professional.
annotation.committeeNotes: This is in the core because Controlled Drugs must be signed for and the recievers identiy must be recorded.

annotation.definition: Extra information about the dispense that could not be conveyed in the other attributes.

annotation.shortDefinition: Medicine administration instructions to the patient/carer
annotation.definition: Indicates how the medication is to be used by the patient.
annotation.comment: When the dose or rate is intended to change over the entire administration period, eg. Tapering dose prescriptions, multiple instances of dosage instructions will need to be supplied to convey the different doses/rates.
annotation.committeeNotes: The RMIM has priority code on the act relationship. How do we handle this?

annotation.shortDefinition: Deals with substitution of one medicine for another
annotation.definition: Indicates whether or not substitution was made as part of the dispense. In some cases substitution will be expected but doesn't happen, in other cases substitution is not expected but does happen. This block explains what substitition did or did not happen and why.
annotation.todo: Shouldn't substitution be captured on a product by product basis?
annotation.committeeNotes: Significant discssion around this topic. May not have it right yet. What about the attribution?

invariant.name: mdd-1
invariant.human: whenHandedOver cannot be before whenPrepared
invariant.xpath: not(exists(f:whenHandedOver/@value)) or not(exists(f:whenPrepared/@value)) or ( f:whenHandedOver/@value >= f:whenPrepared/@value)
