annotations.shortDefinition: Prescription of medication to for patient
annotations.definition: An order for both supply of the medication and the instructions for administration of the medicine to a patient.
A nested type in MedicationPrescription: Indicates how the medication is to be used by the patient.

annotation.definition: Free text dosage instructions can be used for cases where the instructions are too complex to code. When coded instructions are present, the free text instructions may still be present for display to humans taking or administering the medication.
annotation.v2Mapping: RXE-7.2-Provider's Administration Instructions.text / RXO-7.2-Provider's Administration Instructions.text / TQ1-10-Condition Text / TQ1-11-Text Instruction

annotation.definition: Additional instructions such as "Swallow with plenty of water" which may or may not be coded.
annotation.v2Mapping: RXE-7.2-Provider's Administration Instructions.text / RXO-7.2-Provider's Administration Instructions.text / TQ1-10-Condition Text / TQ1-11-Text Instruction ?

annotation.definition: The timing schedule for giving the medication to the patient. The Schedule data type allows many different expressions, for example. "Every 8 hours"; "Three times a day"; "1/2 an hour before breakfast for 10 days from 23-Dec 2011:"; "15 Oct 2013, 17 Oct 2013 and 1 Nov 2013".

If set to true or if specified as a CodeableConcept, indicates that the medication is only taken when needed within the specified schedule rather than at every scheduled dose. If a CodeableConcept is present, it indicates the pre-condition for taking the Medication.
annotation.rimMapping: boolean: precondition.negationInd (inversed - so negationInd = true means asNeeded=false CodeableConcept: precondition.observationEventCriterion[code="Assertion"].value

annotation.definition: A coded specification of the anatomic site where the medication first enters the body.
A code specifying the route or physiological path of administration of a therapeutic agent into or onto a patient.

A coded value indicating the method by which the medication is introduced into or onto the body. Most commonly used for injections. Examples: Slow Push; Deep IV. Terminologies used often pre-coordinate this term with the route and or form of administration.
The amount of therapeutic or other substance given at one administration event.
annotation.comment: Note that this specifies the quantity of the specified medication, not the quantity of active ingredient(s). The prescribed strength can be calculated by multiplying the doseQuantity by the strength of each active ingredient in the prescribed Medication. If the administration is not intended to be instantaneous (rate is present or timing has a duration), this can be specified to convey the total amount to be administered over the period of time as indicated by the schedule.
annotation.v2Mapping: RXE-23-Give Rate Amount / RXE-24.1-Give Rate Units.code / RXE-24.3-Give Rate Units.name of coding system

annotation.shortDefinition: Amount of medication per unit of time
annotation.definition: Identifies the speed with which the substance is introduced into the subject. Typically the rate for an infusion. 200ml in 2 hours.
annotation.comment: It is possible to supply both a rate and a doseQuantity to provide full details about how the medication is to be administered and supplied. If the rate is intended to change over time, each change should be captured as a distinct "dosage" repetition, except for titration orders.

annotation.shortDefinition: Upper limit on medication per unit of time
annotation.definition: The maximum total quantity of a therapeutic substance that may be administered to a subject over the period of time. E.g. 1000mg in 24 hours.
annotation.comment: This is intended for use as an adjunct to the dosage when there is an upper cap. For example "2 tablets ever 4 hours to a maximum of 8/day".

annotations.definition: A nested type in MedicationPrescription: Indicates whether or not substitution can or should be part of the dispense. In some cases substitution must happen, in other cases substitution must not happen, and in others it does not matter. This block explains the prescriber's intent. If nothing is specified substitution may be done.

annotation.definition: A code signifying whether a different drug should be dispensed from what was prescribed.
Indicates the reason for the substitution, or why substitution must or must not be performed.

annotations.definition: A nested type in MedicationPrescription: Deals with details of the dispense part of the order.

annotation.definition: Identifies the medication being administered. This is a link to a resource that represents the medication which may be the details of the medication or simply an attribute carrying a code that identifies the medication from a known list of medications.
annotation.v2Mapping: RXE-2-Give Code / RXO-1-Requested Give Code / RXD-2-Dispense/Give Code

annotation.shortDefinition: Time period supply is authorized for
annotation.definition: Design Comments: This indicates the validity period of a prescription (stale dating the Prescription) It reflects the prescriber perspective for the validity of the prescription. Dispenses must not be made against the prescription outside of this period. The lower-bound of the Dispensing Window signifies the earliest date that the prescription can be filled for the first time. If an upper-bound is not specified then the Prescription is open-ended or will default to a stale-date based on regulations. Rationale: Indicates when the Prescription becomes valid, and when it ceases to be a dispensable Prescription.
annotation.todo: Check v2 mapping.

annotation.definition: An integer indicating the number of repeats of the Dispense. UsageNotes: For example, the number of times the prescribed quantity is to be supplied including the initial standard fill.
annotation.comment: If displaying "number of authorized refills", subtract 1 from this number.
annotation.todo: Can this name be shortened?

annotation.shortDefinition: Amount of medication to supply per dispense
annotation.definition: The amount that is to be dispensed for one fill.
annotation.v2Mapping: RXD-4-Actual Dispense Amount / RXD-5.1-Actual Dispense Units.code / RXD-5.3-Actual Dispense Units.name of coding system

annotation.definition: Identifies the period time over which the supplied product is expected to be used, or the length of time the dispense is expected to last. In some situations, this attribute may be used instead of quantity to identify the amount supplied by how long it is expected to last, rather than the physical quantity issued, e.g. 90 days supply of medication (based on an ordered dosage) When possible, it is always better to specify quantity, as this tends to be more precise. expectedSupplyDuration will always be an estimate that can be influenced by external factors.

binding.name: MedicationAdministrationMethod
binding.definition: A coded concept describing the technique by which the medicine is administered

binding.name: MedicationAsNeededReason
binding.definition: A coded concept identifying the pre-condition that should hold prior to consuming a medication dose. For example "pain", "30 minutes prior to sexual intercourse", "on flare-up", etc.

binding.name: MedicationAdministrationSite
binding.definition: A coded concept describing the site location the medicine enters into or onto the body

binding.name: MedicationPrescriptionStatus
binding.definition: A code specifying the state of the prescribing event. Describes the lifecycle of the prescription.

code.definition: The prescription is 'actionable', but not all actions that are implied by it have occurred yet.
Actions implied by the prescription have been temporarily halted, but are expected to continue later. May also be called "suspended".
All actions that are implied by the prescription have occurred (this will rarely be made explicit).
The prescription was entered in error and therefore nullified.
Actions implied by the prescription have been permanently halted, before all of them occurred.
The prescription was replaced by a newer one, which encompasses all the information in the previous one.
The prescription is not yet 'actionable', i.e. it is a work in progress, required sign-off, need to be run through decision support.

binding.name: MedicationIntendedSubstitutionType
binding.definition: A coded concept describing whether a different medicinal product may be dispensed other than the product as specified exactly in the prescription

binding.name: RouteOfAdministration
binding.definition: A coded concept describing the route or physiological path of administration of a therapeutic agent into or onto the body of a subject.

binding.name: MedicationIntendedSubstitutionReason
binding.definition: A coded concept describing the reason that a different medication should (or should not) be substituted from what was prescribed.

annotation.definition: External identifier - one that would be used by another non-FHIR system - for example a re-imbursement system might issue its own id for each prescription that is created. This is particularly important where FHIR only provides part of an erntire workflow process where records have to be tracked through an entire system.

code.definition: The medication is still being taken.

Identifies the medication being administered. This is either a link to a resource representing the details of the medication or a simple attribute carrying a code that identifies the medication from a known list of medications.
annotation.comment: Note: do not use Medication.name to describe the medication this statement concerns. When the only available information is a text description of the medication, Medication.code.text should be used.

annotation.shortDefinition: Details of how medication was taken
annotation.definition: Indicates how the medication is/was used by the patient.
annotation.committeeNotes: The RMIM has priority code on the act relationship. How do we handle this?

search.name: medication
search.description: Code for medicine or text in medicine name

search.name: patient
search.description: The identity of a patient to list statements for

search.name: source
search.description: Who the information in the statement came from

search.name: status
search.description: Return statements that match the given status

search.name: identifier
search.description: Return statements with this external identity

search.name: effectivedate
search.description: Date when patient was taking (or not taking) the medication

annotations.shortDefinition: A resource that describes a message that is exchanged between systems
annotations.definition: The header for a message exchange that is either requesting or responding to an action. The Reference(s) that are the subject of the action as well as other Information related to the action are typically transmitted in a bundle in which the MessageHeader resource instance is the first resource in the bundle.
annotations.requirements: Many implementations are not prepared to use REST and need a messaging based infrastructure.

annotations.definition: A nested type in MessageHeader: The destination application which the message is intended for.

annotation.definition: Human-readable name for the target system.
annotation.requirements: May be used for routing of response and/or to support audit.

annotation.shortDefinition: Particular delivery destination within the destination
annotation.definition: Identifies the target end system in situations where the initial message transmission is to an intermediary system.
annotation.requirements: Supports multi-hop routing.

annotation.definition: Indicates where the message should be routed to.
annotation.comment: The id may be a non-resolvable URI for systems that do not use standard network-based addresses.
annotation.requirements: Identifies where to route the message.
annotation.v2Mapping: MSH-25-receiving network address (or MSH-6-receiving facility by implication)

annotations.definition: A nested type in MessageHeader: The source application from which this message originated.

annotation.definition: Human-readable name for the source system.
annotation.requirements: May be used to support audit.

annotation.shortDefinition: Name of software running the system
annotation.definition: May include configuration or other information useful in debugging.
annotation.requirements: Supports audit and possibly interface engine behavior.

annotation.definition: Can convey versions of multiple systems in situations where a message passes through multiple hands.
annotation.requirements: Supports audit and possibly interface engine behavior.
annotation.v2Mapping: SFT-2-software certified version or release number
annotation.committeeNotes: Version is not captured as a distinct property in v3.

annotation.definition: An e-mail, phone, website or other contact point to use to resolve issues with message communications.
annotation.requirements: Allows escalation of technical issues.
annotation.rimMapping: unique(./entity[determinerCode="INST" and classCode="DEV"]/scopesRole[normalRole() and classCode="CON" and layer[classCode="PSN"]/telecom[isNormalDatatype()])
annotation.committeeNotes: Should actually have a code for the role in the v3 mapping to indicate that the contact is for "problems".

annotation.shortDefinition: Actual message source address or id
annotation.definition: Identifies the routing target to send acknowledgements to.
annotation.comment: The id may be a non-resolvable URI for systems that do not use standard network-based addresses.
annotation.requirements: Identifies where to send responses, may influence security permissions.

annotations.definition: A nested type in MessageHeader: Information about the message that this message is a response to. Only present if this message is a response.

annotation.definition: The id of the message that this message is a response to.
annotation.requirements: Allows receiver to know what message is being responded to.

annotation.definition: Code that identifies the type of response to the message - whether it was successful or not, and whether it should be resent or not.
annotation.comment: This is a generic response to the request message. Specific data for the response will be found in MessageHeader.data.
annotation.requirements: Allows the sender of the acknowledge message to know if the request was successful or if action is needed.

annotation.definition: Full details of any issues found in the message.
annotation.comment: This SHALL be contained in the bundle. If any of the issues are errors, the response code SHALL be an error.
annotation.requirements: Allows the sender of the message to determine what the specific issues are.

binding.name: ResponseType
binding.definition: The kind of response to a message

code.definition: The message was accepted and processed without error.

Some internal unexpected error occurred - wait and try again. Note - this is usually used for things like database unavailable, which may be expected to resolve, though human intervention may be required.
The message was rejected because of some content in it. There is no point in re-sending without change. The response narrative SHALL describe what the issue is.

binding.name: EventReason
binding.definition: Reason for event occurrence

annotation.definition: The identifier of this message.
annotation.comment: This SHALL be unique within the scope of this stream of messages.

annotation.shortDefinition: Time that the message was sent
annotation.definition: The time that the message was sent.
annotation.requirements: Allows limited detection of out-of-order and delayed transmission. Also supports audit.

annotation.shortDefinition: Code for the event this message represents
annotation.definition: Code that identifies the event this message represents and connects it with its definition. Events defined as part of the FHIR specification have the system value "http://hl7.org/fhir/message-type".
annotation.requirements: Drives the behavior associated with this message.

annotation.shortDefinition: If this is a reply to prior message
annotation.definition: Information about the message that this message is a response to. Only present if this message is a response.
The source application from which this message originated.
annotation.requirements: Allows replies, supports audit.

annotation.definition: The destination application which the message is intended for.
annotation.comment: there SHOULD be at least one destination, but in some circumstances, the source system is unaware of any particular destination system.
annotation.requirements: Indicates where message is to be sent to for routing purposes. Allows verification of "am I the intended recipient".

annotation.shortDefinition: The source of the data entry
annotation.definition: The person or device that performed the data entry leading to this message. Where there is more than one candidate, pick the most proximal to the message. Can provide other enterers in extensions.
annotation.comment: Usually only for the request, but can be used in a response.
annotation.requirements: Need to know for audit/traceback requirements and possibly for authorization.
annotation.rimMapping: unique(./controlAct[classCode="CACT" and classCode="EVN" and isNormalAct()]/participation[typeCode="ENT" and isNormalParticipation]/role[classCode="ASSIGNED" and isNormalRole()]/player[isNormalEntity() and classCode=("DEV", "PSN") and determinerCode="INST"])
annotation.v2Mapping: EVN-5-operator ID / ORC-10-entered by / PRT-5-Participation Person:PRT-4-Participation='EP' / ROL where ROL.3 is EP or ORC.10

annotation.definition: The logical author of the message - the person or device that decided the described event should happen. Where there is more than one candidate, pick the most proximal to the MessageHeader. Can provide other authors in extensions.
annotation.comment: Usually only for the request, but can be used in a response.
annotation.requirements: Need to know for audit/traceback requirements and possibly for authorization.
annotation.rimMapping: unique(./controlAct[classCode="CACT" and classCode="EVN" and isNormalAct()]/participation[isHighest(priorityCode) and typeCode="AUT" and isNormalParticipation]/role[classCode="ASSIGNED" and isNormalRole()]/player[isNormalEntity() and classCode=("DEV", "PSN") and determinerCode="INST"])
annotation.v2Mapping: ORC-19-action by / PRT-5-Participation Person:PRT-4-Participation='AUT' / ROL where ROL.3 is IP or ORC.12

annotation.definition: Allows data conveyed by a message to be addressed to a particular person or department when routing to a specific application isn't sufficient.
annotation.requirements: Allows routing beyond just the application level.
annotation.rimMapping: Not directly supported. Could be shared using attentionLine.value with an appropriate keyWordText
annotation.committeeNotes: Is this in the 80%?

annotation.definition: The person or organization that accepts overall responsibility for the contents of the message. The implication is that the message event happened under the policies of the responsible party.
annotation.comment: Usually only for the request, but can be used in a response.
annotation.requirements: Need to know for audit/traceback requirements and possibly for authorization.
annotation.rimMapping: unique(./controlAct[classCode="CACT" and classCode="EVN" and isNormalAct()]/participation[isHighest(priorityCode) and typeCode="RESP" and isNormalParticipation]/role[classCode="ASSIGNED" and isNormalRole()]/player[isNormalEntity() and classCode="PSN" and determinerCode="INST"] or ./controlAct[classCode="CACT" and classCode="EVN" and isNormalAct()]/participation[isHighest(priorityCode) and typeCode="RESP" and isNormalParticipation]/role[classCode="ASSIGNED" and isNormalRole()]/scoper[isNormalEntity() and classCode="ORG" and determinerCode="INST"])
annotation.v2Mapping: ORC-12-ordering provider / PRT-5-Participation Person:PRT-4-Participation='OP' / PRT-8-Participation Organization:PRT-4-Participation='OP' / ROL where ROL.3 is RO or ORC.11

annotation.definition: Coded indication of the cause for the event - indicates a reason for the occurance of the event that is a focus of this message.
annotation.requirements: Need to be able to track why resources are being changed and report in the audit log/history of the resource. May affect authorization.
annotation.v2Mapping: EVN.4 / ORC.16 / OBR-31-reason for study / BPO-13-BP indication for use / RXO-20-indication / RXE-27-give indication / RXD-21-indication / RXG-22-indication / RXA-19-indication

annotation.shortDefinition: The actual content of the message
annotation.definition: The actual data of the message - a reference to the root/focus class of the event.
annotation.comment: The data is defined where the transaction type is defined. The transaction data is always included in the bundle that is the full message. Only the root resource is specified. The resources it references should be contained in the bundle but are not also listed here. Multiple repetitions are allowed to cater for merges and other situations with multiple focal targets.
annotation.requirements: Every message event is about actual data, a single resource, that is identified in the definition of the event, and perhaps some or all linked resources.
annotation.rimMapping: unique(./controlAct[classCode="CACT" and classCode="EVN" and isNormalAct()]/participation[typeCode="SUBJ" and isNormalParticipation]/role or ./controlAct[classCode="CACT" and classCode="EVN" and isNormalAct()]/outboundRelationship[typeCode="SBJ" and isNormalActRelatoinship]/target)

search.name: destination-uri
search.description: Actual destination address or id

search.name: responsible
search.description: Final responsibility for event

search.name: receiver
search.description: Intended "real-world" recipient for the data

search.name: data
search.description: The actual content of the message

search.name: code
search.description: ok | transient-error | fatal-error

search.name: response-id
search.description: Id of original message

search.name: src-id
search.description: Id of this message

search.name: destination
search.description: Name of system

search.name: timestamp
search.description: Time that the message was sent

search.name: author
search.description: The source of the decision

search.name: source-uri
search.description: Actual message source address or id

search.name: source
search.description: Name of system

search.name: enterer
search.description: The source of the data entry

search.name: event
search.description: Code for the event this message represents

search.name: target
search.description: Particular delivery destination within the destination

annotations.shortDefinition: System of unique identification
annotations.definition: A curated namespace that issues unique symbols within that namespace for the identification of concepts, people, devices, etc. Represents a "System" used within the Identifier and Coding data types.
A nested type in NamingSystem: Contacts to assist a user in finding and communicating with the publisher.

annotation.shortDefinition: Name of a individual to contact
annotation.definition: The name of an individual to contact regarding the naming system.
annotation.comment: If there is no named individual, the telecom is for the organization as a whole.

annotation.shortDefinition: Contact details for individual or publisher
annotation.definition: Contact details for individual (if a name was provided) or the publisher.

annotations.definition: A nested type in NamingSystem: Indicates how the system may be identified when referenced in electronic exchange.

annotation.definition: Identifies the unique identifier scheme used for this particular identifier.
annotation.comment: Different identifier types may be used in different types of communications (OIDs for v3, URIs for FHIR, etc.). Other includes RUIDs from v3, standard v2 code name strings, etc.

annotation.definition: The string that should be sent over the wire to identify the code system or identifier system.

annotation.shortDefinition: Is this the id that should be used for this type
annotation.definition: Indicates whether this identifier is the "preferred" identifier of this type.
Identifies the period of time over which this identifier is considered appropriate to refer to the namingsystem. Outside of this window, the identifier might be non-deterministic.
annotation.comment: Within a registry, a given identifier should only be "active" for a single namespace at a time. (Ideally, an identifier should only ever be associated with a single namespace across all time).

binding.name: NamingSystemType
binding.definition: Identifies the purpose of the namingsystem

code.definition: The namingsystem is used to define concepts and symbols to represent those concepts. E.g. UCUM, LOINC, NDC code, local lab codes, etc.
The namingsystem is used to manage identifiers (e.g. license numbers, order numbers, etc.).
The namingsystem is used as the root for other identifiers and namingsystems.

binding.name: Country
binding.description: The complete set of ISO country codes, as maintained form time to time
binding.definition: Codes for identifying countries

binding.name: NamingSystemIdentifierType
binding.definition: Identifies the style of unique identifier used to identify a namepace

code.definition: An ISO object identifier. E.g. 1.2.3.4.5.
A universally unique identifier of the form a5afddf4-e880-459b-876e-e4591b0acc11.
A uniform resource identifier (ideally a URL - uniform resource locator). E.g. http://unitsofmeasure.org.
Some other type of unique identifier. E.g HL7-assigned reserved string such as LN for LOINC.

binding.name: NamingSystemCategory
binding.definition: Identifies the general purpose of the namingsystem identifiers provided. E.g. Driver, Provider, Patient, Bank, etc.

annotation.definition: Indicates the purpose for the namingsystem - what kinds of things does it make unique?
The descriptive name of this particular identifier type or code system.
annotation.comment: The"symbolic name" for an OID would be captured as an extension.

annotation.definition: The date (and optionally time) when the system was registered or published.
Indicates whether the namingsystem is "ready for use" or not.

If present, indicates that the identifier or code system is principally intended for use or applies to entities within the specified country. For example, the country associated with a national code system.

annotation.shortDefinition: e.g. driver, provider, patient, bank etc
annotation.definition: Categorizes a namingsystem for easier search by grouping related namingsystems.
annotation.comment: This will most commonly be used for identifier namespaces, but categories could potentially be useful for code systems and authorities as well.

annotation.definition: The name of the organization that is responsible for issuing identifiers or codes for this namespace and ensuring their non-collision.
annotation.comment: This is the primary organization. Responsibility for some aspects of a namespace may be delegated.

annotation.definition: Details about what the namespace identifies including scope, granularity, version labeling, etc.
Provides guidance on the use of the namespace, including the handling of formatting characters, use of upper vs. lower case, etc.
Indicates how the system may be identified when referenced in electronic exchange.
annotation.comment: Multiple identifiers may exist, either due to duplicate registration, regional rules, needs of different communication technologies, etc.

annotation.shortDefinition: Name of the publisher (Organization or individual)
annotation.definition: The name of the individual or organization that published the naming system.
annotation.comment: Usually an organization, but may be an individual. This item SHOULD be populated unless the information is available from context.
annotation.requirements: Helps establish the "authority/credibility" of the naming system. May also allow for contact.

annotation.definition: Contacts to assist a user in finding and communicating with the publisher.
annotation.comment: May be a web site, an email address, a telephone number (tel:), etc.

annotation.definition: For namingsystems that are retired, indicates the namingsystem that should be used in their place (if any).

invariant.name: nsd-2
invariant.human: Can't have more than one preferred identifier for a type
invariant.xpath: not(exists(for $type in distinct-values(f:uniqueId/f:type) return if (count(f:uniqueId[f:type/@value=$type and f:primary/@value='true'])>1) then $type else ()))

invariant.name: nsd-3
invariant.human: Can only have replacedBy if namingsystem is retired

invariant.name: nsd-1
invariant.human: Root systems cannot have uuid or sid identifiers

search.name: responsible
search.description: Who maintains system namespace?

search.name: status
search.description: draft | active | retired

search.name: idtype
search.description: oid | uuid | uri | other

search.name: replacedby
search.description: Use this instead

search.name: type
search.description: codesystem | identifier | root

search.name: date
search.description: Publication Date(/time)

search.name: period
search.description: When is identifier valid?

search.name: contact
search.description: Name of a individual to contact

search.name: country
search.description: ISO 3-char country code

search.name: publisher
search.description: Name of the publisher (Organization or individual)

search.name: category
search.description: e.g. driver, provider, patient, bank etc

search.name: name
search.description: Human-readable label

search.name: telecom
search.description: Contact details for individual or publisher

search.name: value
search.description: The unique identifier

annotations.shortDefinition: A request for a diet, formula or nutritional supplement
annotations.definition: A request to supply a diet, formula feeding (enteral) or oral nutritional supplement to a patient/resident.
annotations.comment: Referenced by an Order Request (workflow).

annotations.definition: A nested type in NutritionOrder: Diet given orally in contrast to enteral (tube) feeding.

annotation.shortDefinition: Type of oral diet or diet restrictions that describe what can be consumed orally
annotation.definition: The kind of diet or dietary restriction such as fiber restricted diet or diabetic diet.
annotation.committeeNotes: renamed from .code to .type for consistency.

annotation.definition: The time period and frequency at which the diet should be given.
annotation.committeeNotes: 2/4/2015 EH: [#3996] Remove NutritionOrder.Item and push schedule/timing down into each type.

annotation.definition: Class that defines the quantity and type of nutrient modifications required for the oral diet.
Class that describes any texture modifications required for the patient to safely consume various types of solid foods.

annotation.shortDefinition: The required consistency of fluids and liquids provided to the patient
annotation.definition: The required consistency (e.g., honey-thick, nectar-thick, thin, thickened.) of liquids or fluids served to the patient.

annotation.shortDefinition: Instructions or additional information about the oral diet
annotation.definition: Free text or additional instructions or information pertaining to the oral diet.
annotation.comment: Free text dosage instructions can be used for cases where the instructions are too complex to code.

annotations.definition: A nested type in NutritionOrder: Oral nutritional products given in order to add further nutritional value to the patient's diet.

annotation.definition: The kind of nutritional supplement product required such as a high protein or pediatric clear liquid supplement.

annotation.shortDefinition: Product or brand name of the nutritional supplement
annotation.definition: The product or brand name of the nutritional supplement such as "Acme Protein Shake".
annotation.committeeNotes: 2/4/2015 EH: [#4000][#4001][#4002] change ...name to ...productName.

annotation.definition: The time period and frequency at which the supplement(s) should be given.
annotation.committeeNotes: 2/4/2015 EH: [#3996] Remove NutritionOrder.Item and push schedule/timing down into each type.

annotation.definition: The amount of the nutritional supplement to be given.

annotation.shortDefinition: Instructions or additional information about the oral supplement
annotation.definition: Free text or additional instructions or information pertaining to the oral supplement.
annotation.comment: Free text dosage instructions can be used for cases where the instructions are too complex to code.

annotations.definition: A nested type in NutritionOrder: Feeding provided through the gastrointestinal tract via a tube, catheter, or stoma that delivers nutrition distal to the oral cavity.

annotation.shortDefinition: Formula feeding instructions expressed as text
annotation.definition: Free text formula administration, feeding instructions or additional instructions or information.
annotation.comment: Free text dosage instructions can be used for cases where the instructions are too complex to code.

annotation.shortDefinition: Type of enteral or infant formula
annotation.definition: The type of enteral or infant formula such as an adult standard formula with fiber or a soy-based infant formula.

annotation.shortDefinition: Product or brand name of the enteral or infant formula
annotation.definition: The product or brand name of the enteral or infant formula product such as "ACME Adult Standard Formula".
annotation.committeeNotes: 2/4/2015 EH: [#4000][#4001][#4002] change ...name to ...productName.

annotation.definition: The time period and frequency at which the enteral formula should be delivered to the patient.
annotation.committeeNotes: 2/4/2015 EH: [#3996] Remove NutritionOrder.Item and push schedule/timing down into each type.

annotation.shortDefinition: Type of modular component to add to the feeding
annotation.definition: Indicates the type of modular component such as protein, carbohydrate, fat or fiber to be provided in addition to or mixed with the base formula.
annotation.rimMapping: N/A (not differentiated from NutritionalFormulaType in V3)

annotation.shortDefinition: Product or brand name of the modular additive
annotation.definition: The product or brand name of the type of modular component to be added to the formula.
annotation.committeeNotes: 2/4/2015 EH: [#4000][#4001][#4002] change ...name to ...productName.

annotation.shortDefinition: Amount of energy per specified volume that is required
annotation.definition: The amount of energy (Calories) that the formula should provide per specified volume, typically per mL or fluid oz. For example, an infant may require a formula the provides 24 Calories per fluid ounce or an adult may require an enteral formula that provides 1.5 Calorie/mL.

annotation.shortDefinition: How the formula should enter the patient's gastrointestinal tract
annotation.definition: The route or physiological path of administration into the patient 's gastrointestinal tract for purposes of providing the formula feeding, e.g., nasogastric tube.

annotation.shortDefinition: The volume of formula to provide
annotation.definition: The volume of formula to provide to the patient per the specified administration schedule.

annotation.shortDefinition: Speed with which the formula is provided per period of time
annotation.definition: The rate of administration of formula via a feeding pump, e.g., 60 mL per hour, according to the specified schedule.

annotation.shortDefinition: Change in the rate of administration over a given time
annotation.definition: The change in the rate of administration over a given time, e.g. increase by 10 mL/hour every 4 hours.

annotation.shortDefinition: Upper limit on formula volume per unit of time
annotation.definition: The maximum total quantity of formula that may be administered to a subject over the period of time, e.g., 1440 mL over 24 hours.

annotations.definition: A nested type in NutritionOrder: Class that defines the quantity and type of nutrient modifications required for the oral diet.

annotation.shortDefinition: Type of nutrient that is being modified
annotation.definition: The nutrient that is being modified such as carbohydrate or sodium.
The quantity of the specified nutrient to include in diet.
annotation.committeeNotes: 2/4/2015 EH: [#4004] remove choice from .nutient.amount.

annotations.definition: A nested type in NutritionOrder: Class that describes any texture modifications required for the patient to safely consume various types of solid foods.

annotation.shortDefinition: Code to indicate how to alter the texture of the foods, e.g., pureed
annotation.definition: Any texture modifications (for solid foods) that should be made, e.g. easy to chew, chopped, ground, and pureed.
annotation.comment: Coupled with the foodType (Meat).

annotation.shortDefinition: Concepts that are used to identify an entity that is ingested for nutritional purposes
annotation.definition: The food type(s) (e.g., meats, all foods) that the texture modification applies to. This could be all foods types.
annotation.comment: Coupled with the textureModifier; could be (All Foods).

binding.name: FluidConsistencyType
binding.definition: Codes used to represent the consistency of fluids and liquids provided to the patient.

binding.name: SupplementType
binding.definition: Codes for nutritional supplements to be provided to the patient

binding.name: EnteralFormulaType
binding.definition: Codes for type of enteral formula to be administered to patient.

binding.name: OralDiet
binding.definition: Codes used to indicate the type of diet being ordered for a patient.

binding.name: FoodType
binding.definition: Codes used to indicate the type of food that should NOT be given to the patient.

binding.name: NutrientModifier
binding.definition: Codes for types of nutrient that is being modified such as carbohydrate or sodium.

binding.name: TextureModifiedFoodType
binding.definition: Codes for types of foods that are texture modified.

binding.name: TextureModifier
binding.definition: Codes for food consistency types or texture modifications to apply to foods.

binding.name: EnteralFormulaAdditiveType
binding.definition: Codes for the type of modular component such as protein, carbohydrate or fiber to be provided in addition to or mixed with the base formula.

binding.name: NutritionOrderStatus
binding.definition: Codes specifying the state of the request. Describes the lifecycle of the nutrition order.

code.definition: The request has been proposed.
The request is in preliminary form prior to being sent.
The request has been planned.
The request has been placed.
The request is 'actionable', but not all actions that are implied by it have occurred yet.
Actions implied by the request have been temporarily halted, but are expected to continue later. May also be called "suspended".
All actions that are implied by the order have occurred and no continuation is planned (this will rarely be made explicit).
The request has been withdrawn and is no longer actionable.

binding.name: EnteralRouteOfAdministration
binding.definition: Codes specifying the route of administration of enteral formula.

annotation.shortDefinition: The person who requires the diet, formula or nutritional supplement
annotation.definition: The person (patient) who needs the nutrition order for an oral diet, nutritional supplement and/or enteral or formula feeding.
annotation.committeeNotes: 2/4/2015 EH: [#3707] change subject to patient.

annotation.shortDefinition: Who ordered the diet, formula or nutritional supplement
annotation.definition: The practitioner that holds legal responsibility for ordering the diet, nutritional supplement, or formula feedings.
Identifiers assigned to this order by the order sender or by the order receiver.

annotation.shortDefinition: The encounter associated with that this nutrition order
annotation.definition: An encounter that provides additional information about the healthcare context in which this request is made.

annotation.shortDefinition: Date and time the nutrition order was requested
annotation.definition: The date and time that this nutrition order was requested.

annotation.shortDefinition: proposed | draft | planned | requested | active | on-hold | completed | cancelled
annotation.definition: The workflow status of the nutrition order/request.
annotation.comment: Typically the system placing the order sets the status to requested. There after, the order is maintained by the receiver that updates the status as the request is handled.

annotation.shortDefinition: List of the patient's food and nutrition-related allergies and intolerances
annotation.definition: A link to a record of allergies or Intolerances which should be included in the nutrition order.
annotation.comment: Information on a patient's food allergies and intolerances, inform healthcare personnel about the type of foods that the patient should receive or consume.
annotation.committeeNotes: resource reference.

annotation.shortDefinition: Order-specific modifier about the type of food that should be given
annotation.definition: This modifier is used to convey order-specific modifiers about the type of food that should be given. These can be derived from patient allergies, intolerances, or preferences such as Halal, Vegan or Kosher. This modifier applies to the entire nutrition order inclusive of the oral diet, nutritional supplements and enteral formula feedings.
annotation.comment: Information on a patient's food preferences inform healthcare personnel about the food that the patient should receive or consume.
annotation.committeeNotes: Discussion at WGM Mon Q3 - maybe .foodPreferenceModifier --how to convey the patient No Soy, No Red Meat? (without a negation indicator) Do what domain expects e.g. ExcludeFoodType and IncludeFoodPreference.

annotation.shortDefinition: Order-specific modifier about the type of food that should not be given
annotation.definition: This modifier is used to convey order-specific modifiers about the type of food that should NOT be given. These can be derived from patient allergies, intolerances, or preferences such as No Red Meat, No Soy or No Wheat or Gluten-Free. This modifier applies to the entire nutrition order inclusive of the oral diet, nutritional supplements and enteral formula feedings.
annotation.comment: Information on a patient's food allergies and intolerances, and preferences inform healthcare personnel about the type of foods that the patient should receive or consume.
annotation.committeeNotes: Discussion at WGM Mon Q3 - maybe .foodPreferenceModifier --how to convey the patient No Soy, No Red Meat? (without a negation indicator) Do what domain expects e.g. ExcludeFoodType and IncludeFoodPreference.

annotation.definition: Diet given orally in contrast to enteral (tube) feeding.
Oral nutritional products given in order to add further nutritional value to the patient's diet.
Feeding provided through the gastrointestinal tract via a tube, catheter, or stoma that delivers nutrition distal to the oral cavity.

invariant.name: nor-1
invariant.human: Nutrition Order SHALL contain either Oral Diet , Supplement, or Enteral Formula class

example.name: Pureed Diet Simple
example.description: Nutrition Order Pureed Diet and Energy/Protein Supplement Simple Example

example.name: Low Sodium and Fiber Restricted Diet
example.description: Nutrition Order Low Sodium and Fiber Restricted Diet Example

example.name: Low Fat and Fiber Restricted Diet
example.description: Nutrition Order Low Fat and Fiber Restricted Diet Example

example.name: Enteral Bolus
example.description: Nutrition Order Enteral Bolus Feeding Example

example.name: Enteral Continuous Feeding
example.description: Nutrition Order Enteral Continuous Feeding Example

example.name: Infant Enteral
example.description: Nutrition Order Infant Enteral Feeding Example

search.name: patient
search.description: The identity of the person who requires the diet, formula or nutritional supplement

search.name: status
search.description: Status of the nutrition order.

search.name: supplement
search.description: Type of supplement product requested

search.name: oraldiet
search.description: Type of diet that can be consumed orally (i.e., take via the mouth).

search.name: provider
search.description: The identify of the provider who placed the nutrition order

search.name: encounter
search.description: Return nutrition orders with this encounter identity

annotations.shortDefinition: Measurements and simple assertions
annotations.definition: Measurements and simple assertions made about a patient, device or other subject.
annotations.comment: Used for simple observations such as device measurements, laboratory atomic results, vital signs, height, weight, smoking status, comments, etc. Other resources are used to provide context for observations such as Lab reports, etc.
annotations.requirements: Observations are a key aspect of healthcare. This resource is used to capture those that do not require more sophisticated mechanisms.

annotations.definition: A nested type in Observation: Guidance on how to interpret the value by comparison to a normal or recommended range.

annotation.definition: The value of the low bound of the reference range. If this element is omitted, the low bound of the reference range is assumed to be meaningless. (e.g. reference range is <2.3) If the low.comparator element is missing, it is assumed to be '>'.

The value of the high bound of the reference range. If this element is omitted, the high bound of the reference range is assumed to be meaningless. (e.g. reference range is > 5) If the low.comparator element is missing , it is assumed to be '<'.

annotation.shortDefinition: Indicates the meaning/use of this range of this range
annotation.definition: Code for the meaning of the reference range.
annotation.comment: This SHOULD be populated if there is more than one range.
annotation.requirements: Need to be able to say what kind of reference range this is - normal, recommended, therapeutic, or perhaps what state this reference range applies to (i.e. age, hormonal cycles, etc.).

annotation.definition: The age at which this reference range is applicable. This is a neonatal age (e.g. number of weeks at term) if the meaning says so.
annotation.requirements: Some analytes vary greatly over age.

annotation.shortDefinition: Text based reference range in an observation
annotation.definition: Text based reference range in an observation which may be used when a quantitative range is not appropriate for an observation. An example would be a reference value of "Negative" or a list or table of 'normals'.

annotations.definition: A nested type in Observation: Related observations - either components, or previous observations, or statements of derivation.

annotation.shortDefinition: has-component | has-member | derived-from | sequel-to | replaces | qualified-by | interfered-by
annotation.definition: A code specifying the kind of relationship that exists with the target observation.
annotation.comment: A relationship type SHOULD be provided. If the relationship type is "COMP" (composed), then the observation should not be displayed/interpreted in the absence of the related observations.
annotation.requirements: May need to indicate whether this observation is composed of others, or merely derived from them.

annotation.shortDefinition: Observation that is related to this one
annotation.definition: A reference to the observation that is related to this observation.

binding.name: ObservationValueAbsentReason
binding.definition: Codes specifying why the result (Observation.value[x]) is missing

binding.name: ObservationMethod
binding.definition: Methods for simple observations

binding.name: ObservationValue
binding.definition: Codes identifying atomic results of observations when value is type codeableConcept

binding.name: ObservationType
binding.definition: Codes identifying types of simple observations

binding.name: ObservationRangeMeaning
binding.definition: Code for the meaning of a reference range

binding.name: ObservationReliability
binding.definition: Codes that provide an estimate of the degree to which quality issues have impacted on the value of an observation

code.definition: The result has no reliability concerns.
An early estimate of value; measurement is still occurring.
An early estimate of value; processing is still occurring.
The observation value should be treated with care.
The result has been generated while calibration is occurring.
The observation could not be completed because of an error.
No observation reliability value was available.

binding.name: ObservationStatus
binding.definition: Codes providing the status of an observation

code.definition: The existence of the observation is registered, but there is no result yet available.
This is an initial or interim observation: data may be incomplete or unverified.
The observation is complete and verified by an authorized person.
The observation has been modified subsequent to being Final, and is complete and verified by an authorized person.
The observation is unavailable because the measurement was not started or not completed (also sometimes called "aborted").
The observation has been withdrawn following previous Final release.
The observation status is unknown. Note that "unknown" is a value of last resort and every attempt should be made to provide a meaningful value other than "unknown".

binding.name: ObservationInterpretation
binding.definition: Codes identifying interpretations of observations

binding.name: ObservationRelationshipType
binding.definition: Codes specifying how two observations are related

code.definition: The target observation is a component of this observation (e.g. Systolic and Diastolic Blood Pressure).
This observation is a group observation (e.g. a battery, a panel of tests, a set of vital sign measurements) that includes the target as a member of the group.
The target observation is part of the information from which this observation value is derived (e.g. calculated anion gap, Apgar score).
This observation follows the target observation (e.g. timed tests such as Glucose Tolerance Test).
This observation replaces a previous observation (i.e. a revised value). The target observation is now obsolete.
The value of the target observation qualifies (refines) the semantics of the source observation (e.g. a lipaemia measure target from a plasma measure).

The value of the target observation interferes (degardes quality, or prevents valid observation) with the semantics of the source observation (e.g. a hemolysis measure target from a plasma potassium measure which has no value).

annotation.definition: Describes what was observed. Sometimes this is called the observation "code".
annotation.requirements: Knowing what kind of observation is being made is essential to understanding the observation.

annotation.definition: The information determined as a result of making the observation, if the information has a simple value.
annotation.comment: Normally, an observation will have either a value or a set of related observations. A few observations (e.g. apgar store) may have both a value and related observations (for apgar, the observations from which the measure is derived). If a value is present, the datatype for this element should be determined by Observation.code. A CodeableConcept with just a text would be used instead of a string if the field was usually coded, or if the type associated with the Observation.code defines a coded value. For boolean values use valueCodeableConcept and select codes from <http://hl7.org/fhir/v2/vs/0136> (These "yes/no" concepts can be mapped to the display name "true/false" or other mutually exclusive terms that may be needed"). The element, Observation.value[x], has a variable name depending on the type as follows: valueQuantity, valueCodeableConcept, valueRatio, valueChoice, valuePeriod, valueSampleData, or valueString (The name format is "'value' + the type name" with a capital on the first letter of the type).
annotation.requirements: An observation exists to have a value, though it may not if it is in error, or it represents a group of observations.

annotation.definition: Provides a reason why the expected value in the element Observation.value[x] is missing.
annotation.comment: "Null" or exceptional values can be represented two ways in FHIR Observations. One way is to simply include them in the value set and represent the exceptions in the value. For example, measurement values for a serology test could be "detected", "not detected", "inconclusive", or "test not done". The alternate way is to use the value element for actual observations and use the explicit dataAbsentReason element to record exceptional values. For example, the dataAbsentReason code "error" could be used when the measurement was not completed. Because of these options, use-case agreements are required to interpret general observations for exceptional values.
annotation.requirements: For many results it is necessary to handle exceptional values in measurements.

annotation.definition: The assessment made based on the result of the observation.
annotation.requirements: For some results, particularly numeric results, an interpretation is necessary to fully understand the significance of a result.

annotation.definition: May include statements about significant, unexpected or unreliable values, or information about the source of the value where this may be relevant to the interpretation of the result.
annotation.requirements: Need to be able to provide free text additional information.
annotation.v2Mapping: NTE.3 (partner NTE to OBX, or sometimes another (child?) OBX)

annotation.definition: The time or time-period the observed value is asserted as being true. For biological subjects - e.g. human patients - this is usually called the "physiologically relevant time". This is usually either the time of the procedure or of specimen collection, but very often the source of the date/time is not known, only the date/time itself.
annotation.comment: At least a date should be present unless this observation is a historical report.
annotation.requirements: Knowing when an observation was deemed true is important to its relevance as well as determining trends.
annotation.v2Mapping: OBX-14-date/time of the observation, and/or OBX-19 after v2.4 (depends on who observation made)

annotation.definition: The date and time this observation was made available.
annotation.comment: Updated when the result is updated.
annotation.v2Mapping: OBR.22 (or MSH.7), or perhaps OBX-19 (depends on who observation made)

annotation.definition: The status of the result value.
annotation.requirements: Need to track the status of individual results - some results are finalised before the whole report is finalised.
annotation.rimMapping:
status
Amended & Final are differentiated by whether it is the subject of a ControlAct event with a type of "revise"

annotation.shortDefinition: ok | ongoing | early | questionable | calibrating | error +
annotation.definition: An estimate of the degree to which quality issues have impacted on the value reported.
annotation.comment: Note that in most contexts, unreliable results are not recorded, deleted, or otherwise excluded, but it's not always possible to exclude them from the record. If the reliability indicator is present, interpreters of a result, whether human or machine, should always either be aware of the status or prevented from using the observation without being unaware that the reliability is not "ok".
annotation.requirements: Not all results are completely reliable, and some are still reported anyway.

annotation.definition: Indicates the site on the subject's body where the observation was made ( i.e. the target site).
annotation.comment: Only used if not implicit in code found in Observation.code.
annotation.requirements: Knowing where the observation is made is important for tracking if multiple sites are possible.
annotation.committeeNotes: Is this in the 80%?

annotation.definition: Indicates the mechanism used to perform the observation.
annotation.comment: Only used if not implicit in code for Observation.code.
annotation.requirements: In some cases, method can impact results and is thus for determining whether results can be compared or determining significance of results.
annotation.committeeNotes: Is this in the 80%?

annotation.shortDefinition: Unique Id for this particular observation
annotation.definition: A unique identifier for the simple observation.
annotation.requirements: Allows observations to be distinguished and referenced.

annotation.shortDefinition: Who and/or what this is about
annotation.definition: The patient, or group of patients, location, or device whose characteristics (direct or indirect) are described by the observation and into whose record the observation is placed. Comments: Indirect characteristics may be those of a specimen, fetus, other observer (for example a relative or EMT), or any observation made about the subject.
annotation.comment: One would expect this element to be a cardinality of 1..1. The only circumstance in which the subject can be missing is when the observation is made by a device that does not know the patient. In this case, the observation SHALL be matched to a patient through some context/channel matching technique, and at this point, the observation should be updated. If the target of the observation is different than the subject, the general extension (http://hl7.org/fhir/StructureDefinition/indirectTarget) can be used.
annotation.requirements: Observations have no value if you don't know who or what they're about.

annotation.definition: The specimen that was used when this observation was made.
annotation.comment: Observations are not made on specimens themselves; they are made on a subject, but usually by the means of a specimen. Note that although specimens are often involved, they are not always tracked and reported explicitly. Also note that observation resources are often used in contexts that track the specimen explicitly (e.g. Diagnostic Report).

annotation.definition: Who was responsible for asserting the observed value as "true".
annotation.requirements: May give a degree of confidence in the observation and also indicates where follow-up questions should be directed.
annotation.v2Mapping: OBX.15 / (Practitioner) OBX-16-responsible observer, PRT-5-participation person:PRT-4-participation='RO' / (Device) OBX-18-equipment instance identifier , PRT-10-participation device:PRT-4-participation='EQUIP' / (Organization) OBX-23-performing organization name, PRT-8-participation organization:PRT-4-participation='PO'

annotation.definition: The device used to generate the observation data.
annotation.comment: An extension should be used if further typing of the device is needed. Devices used to support obtaining an observation can be represented using either extension or through the Observation.related element.

annotation.shortDefinition: Healthcare event during which this observation is made
annotation.definition: The healthcare event ( e.g. a patient and healthcare provider interaction ) during which this observation is made.
annotation.requirements: For some observations it may be important to know the link between an observation and a particular encounter.
annotation.todo: review mapping.

annotation.definition: Guidance on how to interpret the value by comparison to a normal or recommended range.
annotation.comment: Most observations only have one generic reference range. Systems MAY choose to restrict to only supplying the relevant reference range based on knowledge about the patient (e.g. specific to the patient's age, gender, weight and other factors), but this may not be possible or appropriate. Whenever more than one reference range is supplied, the differences between them SHOULD be provided in the reference range and/or age properties.
annotation.requirements: Knowing what values are considered "normal" can help evaluate the significance of a particular result. Need to be able to provide multiple reference ranges for different contexts.

annotation.definition: Related observations - either components, or previous observations, or statements of derivation.
annotation.comment: Normally, an observation will have either a value or a set of related observations. A few observations (e.g. apgar store) may have both a value and related observations (for apgar, the observations from which the measure is derived).
annotation.requirements: Some observations have important relationships to other observations (e.g Blood Pressure = systolic + diastolic), or are derived from other observations (e.g. calculated apgar score).

invariant.name: obs-6
invariant.human: Shall only be present if Observation.value[x] is not present
