annotation.definition: Nested group, containing nested question for this question. The order of groups within the question is relevant.
annotation.requirements: It is useful to have "sub-questions", questions which normally appear when certain answers are given and which collect additional details.

annotations.definition: A nested type in QuestionnaireAnswers: A group of questions to a possibly similarly grouped set of questions in the questionnaire answers.

annotation.definition: Identifies the group from the Questionnaire that corresponds to this group in the QuestionnaireAnswers resource.
annotation.requirements: Groups can repeat in the answers, so a direct 1..1 correspondence may not exist - requiring correspondence by id.

annotation.definition: Text that is displayed above the contents of the group.
annotation.comment: On the root group, this is the title of the questionnaire.
annotation.requirements: When including text for the questionnaire with the answers, sections may have a section header.

annotation.definition: Additional text for the group, used for display purposes.
annotation.requirements: When including text for the questionnaire, each section may contain additional explanations are background text.

annotation.shortDefinition: The subject this group's answers are about
annotation.definition: More specific subject this section's answers are about, details the subject given in QuestionnaireAnswers.
annotation.requirements: Sometimes a group of answers is about a specific participant, artifact or piece of information in the patient's care or record, e.g. a specific Problem, RelatedPerson, Allergy etc.

annotation.definition: A sub-group within a group. The ordering of groups within this group is relevant.
annotation.requirements: Reports can consist of complex nested groups.

annotation.definition: Set of questions within this group. The order of questions within the group is relevant.
annotation.requirements: Must register answers to questions.

binding.name: QuestionnaireAnswersStatus
binding.definition: Lifecycle status of the questionnaire answers

code.definition: This QuestionnaireAnswers has been partially filled out with answers, but changes or additions are still expected to be made to it.
This QuestionnaireAnswers has been filled out with answers, and the current content is regarded as definitive.
This QuestionnaireAnswers has been filled out with answers, then marked as complete, yet changes or additions have been made to it afterwards.

annotation.shortDefinition: Unique id for this set of answers
annotation.definition: A business identifier assigned to a particular completed (or partially completed) questionnaire.
annotation.requirements: Used for tracking, registration and other business purposes.

annotation.definition: Indicates the Questionnaire resource that defines the form for which answers are being provided.
annotation.requirements: Needed to allow editing of the questionnaire in a manner that enforces the constraints of the original form.

annotation.definition: The lifecycle status of the questionnaire answers as a whole.
annotation.requirements: The information on questionnaires may possibly be gathered during multiple sessions and altered after considered being finished. Questionnaires with just questions may serve as template forms, with the applicable publication statuses.
annotation.rimMapping: .statusCode (also whether there's a revisionControlAct - and possibly mood to distinguish "in-progress" from "published)

annotation.definition: The subject of the questionnaire answers. This could be a patient, organization, practitioner, device, etc. This is who/what the answers apply to, but is not necessarily the source of information.
annotation.requirements: Must know the subject context.

annotation.shortDefinition: Person who received and recorded the answers
annotation.definition: Person who received the answers to the questions in the QuestionnaireAnswers and recorded them in the system.
annotation.comment: Mapping a subject's answers to multiple choice options and determining what to put in the textual answer is a matter of interpretation.
annotation.requirements: Need to know who interpreted the subject's answers to the questions in the questionnaire, and selected the appropriate options for answers.

annotation.definition: The date and/or time that this version of the questionnaire answers was authored.
annotation.comment: May be different from the update time of the resource itself, because that is the status of the collection and authoring. This element is optional to allow for systems that may not know the value, however it SHOULD be populated if possible.
annotation.requirements: Clinicians need to be able to check the date that the information in the questionnaire was collected, to derive the context of the answers.

annotation.shortDefinition: The person who answered the questions
annotation.definition: The person who answered the questions about the subject.
annotation.comment: If not specified, no inference can be made about who provided the data.
annotation.requirements: When answering questions about a subject that is minor, incapable of answering or an animal, another human source is used to answer the questions.

annotation.shortDefinition: Primary encounter during which the answers were collected
annotation.definition: Encounter during which this set of questionnaire answers were collected. When there were multiple encounters, this is the one considered most relevant to the context of the answers.
annotation.requirements: Some institutions track questionnaires under a specific encounter.
annotation.committeeNotes: Is this 80%? Is this 0..*?

annotation.definition: A group of questions to a possibly similarly grouped set of questions in the questionnaire answers.
annotation.comment: The Questionnaire itself has one "root" group with the actual contents of the Questionnaire.
annotation.requirements: Need to be able to logically group answers to grouped questions.

example.name: Lifelines
example.description: Real-world lifelines questionnaire answers (fictively taken from the patient)

example.name: BlueBook
example.description: Real-world NSW My Personal Health Record example

search.name: author
search.description: The author of the questionnaire

search.name: questionnaire
search.description: The questionnaire the answers are provided for

search.name: patient
search.description: The patient that is the subject of the questionnaire

search.name: authored
search.description: When the questionnaire was authored

search.name: source
search.description: The person who answered the questions

search.name: status
search.description: The status of the questionnaire answers

search.name: subject
search.description: The subject of the questionnaire

search.name: encounter
search.description: Encounter during which questionnaire was authored

annotations.shortDefinition: A request for referral or transfer of care
annotations.definition: Used to record and send details about a request for referral service or transfer of a patient to the care of another provider or provider organisation.

binding.name: ReferralStatus
binding.definition: The status of the referral

code.definition: A draft referral that has yet to be send.
The referral has been transmitted, but not yet acknowledged by the recipient.
The referral has been acknowledged by the recipient, and is in the process of being actioned.
The referral has been cancelled without being completed. For example it is no longer needed.
The recipient has declined to accept the referral.
The referral has been completely actioned.

annotation.shortDefinition: draft | sent | active | cancelled | rejected | completed
annotation.definition: The workflow status of the referral or transfer of care request.
Business Id that uniquely identifies the referral/care transfer request instance.
An indication of the type of referral (or where applicable the type of transfer of care) request.
annotation.comment: Examples of referral type: - consultation; second opinion; third opinion - Assume management - Request for procedure(s) HL7 v2.8 Example - Table 0336: S = second opinion p = patient preference o = provider ordered w = work load.

annotation.shortDefinition: The clinical specialty (discipline) that the referral is requested for
annotation.definition: Indication of the clinical domain or discipline to which the referral or transfer of care request is sent.

annotation.shortDefinition: Urgency of referral / transfer of care request
annotation.definition: An indication of the urgency of referral (or where applicable the type of transfer of care) request.

annotation.shortDefinition: Patient referred to care or transfer
annotation.definition: The patient who is the subject of a referral or transfer of care request.
annotation.comment: Referral of family, group or community is to be catered for by profiles.

annotation.shortDefinition: Requester of referral / transfer of care
annotation.definition: The healthcare provider or provider organization who/which initaited the referral/transfer of care request. Can also be Patient (a self referral).

annotation.shortDefinition: Receiver of referral / transfer of care request
annotation.definition: The healthcare provider(s) or provider organization(s) who/which is to receive the referral/transfer of care request.
annotation.comment: There will be a primary receiver. But the request can be received by any number of "copied to" providers or organisations.

annotation.definition: The encounter at which the request for referral or transfer of care is initiated.

annotation.shortDefinition: Date referral/transfer of care request is sent
annotation.definition: Date/DateTime the request for referral or transfer of care is sent by the author.

annotation.shortDefinition: Reason for referral / Transfer of care request
annotation.definition: Description of clinical condition indicating why referral/transfer of care is requested.
annotation.comment: Examples: "2nd degree AV block" Oral Health example ReferralReasonCode: 01 = Pathological Anomalies 02 = Disabled (physical or mental) 03 = Complexity of Treatment 04 = Seizure Disorders 05 = Extensive Surgery 06 = Surgical Complexity 07 = Rampant decay 08 = Medical History (to provide details upon request) 09 = Temporal Mandibular Joint Anomalies 10 = Accidental Injury 11 = Anaesthesia complications (local or general) 12 = Developmental Anomalies 13 = Behavioral Management.

annotation.shortDefinition: A textual description of the referral
annotation.definition: The reason gives a short description of why the referral is being made, the description expands on this to support a more complete clinical summary.
annotation.comment: This would be a good candidate for a 'markdown' data type.

annotation.definition: The service(s) that is/are requested to be provided to the patient.
annotation.comment: Examples: "cardiac pacemaker insertion" HL7 v3 Concept domain - ReferralReasonCode examples: - Specialized medical assistance - Other care requirement.

annotation.shortDefinition: Additonal information to support referral or transfer of care request
annotation.definition: Any additional (administrative, financial or clinical) information required to support request for referral or transfer of care.
annotation.comment: Examples include: Presenting problems/chief complaints Medical History Family History Alerts Allergy/Intolerance and Adverse Reactions Medications Observations/Assessments (may include cognitive and fundtional assessments) Diagnostic Reports Care Plan.

annotation.definition: The period of time within which the services identified in the referral/transfer of care is specified or required to occur.
annotation.requirements: Use cases: (1) to indicate that the requested service is not to happen before a specified date (2) to indicate that the requested service must happen before a specified date (3) to indicate that the requested service must happen during the specified dates ("low" and "high" values).

search.name: requester
search.description: Requester of referral / transfer of care

search.name: patient
search.description: Who the referral is about

search.name: status
search.description: The status of the referral

search.name: priority
search.description: The priority assigned to the referral

search.name: type
search.description: The type of the referral

search.name: specialty
search.description: The specialty that the referral is for

search.name: recipient
search.description: The person that the referral was sent to

annotations.shortDefinition: An person that is related to a patient, but who is not a direct target of care
annotations.definition: Information about a person that is involved in the care for a patient, but who is not the target of healthcare, nor has a formal responsibility in the care process.
annotations.requirements: Need to track persons related to the patient or the healthcare process.
annotations.committeeNotes: Patient contact is defined as a person in role. Hence RelatedPerson should also be a person in role. Struggling with V3 mappings here.

binding.name: PatientRelationshipType
binding.definition: The nature of the relationship between a patient and the related person

annotation.shortDefinition: A Human identifier for this person
annotation.definition: Identifier for a person within a particular scope.
annotation.requirements: People are known by a variety of ids. Some institutions maintain several, and most collect identifiers for exchange with other organizations concerning the patient. Examples are national person identifier and local identifier.
annotation.committeeNotes: Keeping RelatedPerson.id cardinality as a matter of safety in the same manner as Person Activate.

annotation.shortDefinition: The patient this person is related to
annotation.definition: The patient this person is related to.
annotation.requirements: We need to know which Patient this RelatedPerson is related to.
annotation.committeeNotes: This rather complicated V3 mapping traverses the same path that the Patient resource has for contact but in opposite direction.

annotation.definition: The nature of the relationship between a patient and the related person.
annotation.requirements: We need to know the relationship with the patient since it influences the interpretation of the information attributed to this person.

annotation.shortDefinition: A name associated with the person
annotation.definition: A name associated with the person.
annotation.requirements: Related persons need to be identified by name, but it is uncommon to need details about multiple other names for that person.

annotation.shortDefinition: A contact detail for the person
annotation.definition: A contact detail for the person, e.g. a telephone number or an email address.
annotation.comment: Person may have multiple ways to be contacted with different uses or applicable periods. May need to have options for contacting the person urgently, and also to help with identification.
annotation.requirements: People have (primary) ways to contact them in some way such as phone, email.

annotation.definition: Administrative Gender - the gender that the person is considered to have for administration and record keeping purposes.
annotation.requirements: Needed for identification of the person, in combination with (at least) name and birth date.

annotation.shortDefinition: Address where the related person can be contacted or visited
annotation.definition: Address where the related person can be contacted or visited.
annotation.requirements: Need to keep track where the related person can be contacted per postal mail or visited.

annotation.definition: Image of the person.
annotation.requirements: Many EHR systems have the capability to capture an image of persons. Fits with newer social media usage too.

annotation.shortDefinition: Period of time that this relationship is considered valid
annotation.definition: The period of time that this relationship is considered to be valid. If there are no dates defined, then the interval is unknown.

search.name: patient
search.description: The patient this person is related to

search.name: phonetic
search.description: A portion of name using some kind of phonetic matching algorithm

search.name: address
search.description: An address in any kind of address/part

search.name: name
search.description: A portion of name in any name part

search.name: telecom
search.description: The value in any kind of contact

search.name: gender
search.description: Gender of the person

search.name: identifier
search.description: A patient Identifier

annotations.shortDefinition: Potential outcomes for a subject with likelihood
annotations.definition: An assessment of the likely outcome(s) for a patient or other subject as well as the likelihood of each outcome.
A nested type in RiskAssessment: Describes the expected outcome for the subject.

annotation.definition: One of the potential outcomes for the patient (e.g. remission, death, a particular condition).
How likely is the outcome (in the specified timeframe).
annotation.comment:
If range is used, it represents the lower and upper bounds of certainty. E.g. 40-60%
Decimal values are expressed as percentages as well (max = 100).

annotation.definition: Indicates the risk for this particular subject (with their specific characteristics) divided by the risk of the population in general. (Numbers greater than 1 = higher risk than the population, numbers less than 1 = lower risk.).
annotation.requirements: Absolute risk is less meaningful than relative risk.
annotation.todo: Is this in the 80%?

annotation.definition: Indicates the period of time or age range of the subject to which the specified probability applies.
annotation.comment: If not specified, the risk applies "over the subject's lifespan".

annotation.definition: Additional information explaining the basis for the prediction.

binding.name: RiskAssessmentOutcome
binding.definition: The condition or other outcome. E.g. death, remission, amputation, infection, etc.

binding.name: RiskAssessmentMethod
binding.definition: The mechanism or algorithm used to make the assessment. E.g. TIMI, PRISM, Cardiff Type 2 diabetes, etc.

binding.name: RiskAssessmentProbability
binding.definition: The likelihood of the occurrence of a specified outcome

annotation.definition: The patient or group the risk assessment applies to.
annotation.todo: Should this cover anything else? Device? Location?

annotation.definition: The date (and possibly time) the risk assessment was performed.
annotation.requirements: The assessment results lose validity the more time elapses from when they are first made.

annotation.definition: For assessments or prognosis specific to a particular condition, indicates the condition being assessed.
The provider or software application that performed the assessment.
Business identifier assigned to the risk assessment.
The algorithm, processs or mechanism used to evaluate the risk.
annotation.requirements: The method can influence the results of the assessment.
annotation.todo: Is this in the 80%?

annotation.definition: Indicates the source data considered as part of the assessment (FamilyHistory, Observations, Procedures, Conditions, etc.).
Describes the expected outcome for the subject.
annotation.comment: Multiple repetitions can be used to identify the same type of outcome in different timeframes as well as different types of outcomes.

annotation.definition: A description of the steps that might be taken to reduce the identified risk(s).
annotation.requirements: One of the main reasons for assessing risks is to identify whether interventional steps are needed to reduce risk.

search.name: patient
search.description: Who/what does assessment apply to?

search.name: condition
search.description: Condition assessed

search.name: subject
search.description: Who/what does assessment apply to?

search.name: performer
search.description: Who did assessment?

search.name: method
search.description: Evaluation mechanism

search.name: date
search.description: When was assessment made?

search.name: identifier
search.description: Unique identifier for the assessment

annotations.shortDefinition: A container for slot(s) of time that may be available for booking appointments
annotations.definition: A container for slot(s) of time that may be available for booking appointments.

binding.name: ActType
binding.definition: The schedule type can be used for the categorization of healthcare services or other appointment types (This is an example set, not an incomplete - TO BE UDPATED)

annotation.definition: External Ids for this item.

annotation.shortDefinition: The schedule type can be used for the categorization of healthcare services or other appointment types
annotation.definition: The schedule type can be used for the categorization of healthcare services or other appointment types.

annotation.shortDefinition: The resource this Schedule resource is providing availability information for. These are expected to usually be one of HealthcareService, Location, Practitioner, Device, Patient or RelatedPerson
annotation.definition: The resource this Schedule resource is providing availability information for. These are expected to usually be one of HealthcareService, Location, Practitioner, Device, Patient or RelatedPerson.
annotation.committeeNotes: Many discussions were had at 2 WGMs over the name of this field, and considered individual, subject and several others, but landed on this property name as it doesn't have other meanings and is applicable for people, services, locations and devices.

annotation.shortDefinition: The period of time that the slots that are attached to this Schedule resource cover (even if none exist). These cover the amount of time that an organization's planning horizon; the interval for which they are currently accepting appointments. This does not define a "template" for planning outside these dates
annotation.definition: The period of time that the slots that are attached to this Schedule resource cover (even if none exist). These cover the amount of time that an organization's planning horizon; the interval for which they are currently accepting appointments. This does not define a "template" for planning outside these dates.

annotation.shortDefinition: Comments on the availability to describe any extended information. Such as custom constraints on the slot(s) that may be associated
annotation.definition: Comments on the availability to describe any extended information. Such as custom constraints on the slot(s) that may be associated.

search.name: actor
search.description: The individual(HealthcareService, Practitioner, Location, ...) to find a Schedule for

search.name: date
search.description: Search for Schedule resources that have a period that contains this date specified

search.name: type
search.description: The type of appointments that can be booked into associated slot(s)

annotations.shortDefinition: Search Parameter for a resource
annotations.definition: A Search Parameter that defines a named search item that can be used to search/filter on a resource.
annotations.comment: In FHIR, search is not performed directly on a resource (by XML or JSON path), but on a named parameter that maps into the resource content.

annotations.definition: A nested type in SearchParameter: Contacts to assist a user in finding and communicating with the publisher.

annotation.shortDefinition: Name of a individual to contact
annotation.definition: The name of an individual to contact regarding the search parameter.
annotation.comment: If there is no named individual, the telecom is for the organization as a whole.

annotation.shortDefinition: Contact details for individual or publisher
annotation.definition: Contact details for individual (if a name was provided) or the publisher.

annotation.shortDefinition: Literal URL used to reference this search parameter
annotation.definition: An absolute URL at which this search parameter is (or will be) published, and which is used to reference this profile in conformance statements.
annotation.requirements: To allow referencing and reusing search parameter definitions under other names on operational systems (in case of name clash).

annotation.definition: The name of the standard or custom search parameter.
annotation.comment: This is the name to be used for this parameter in the search parameters in the URL.

annotation.shortDefinition: Name of the publisher (Organization or individual)
annotation.definition: The name of the individual or organization that published the search parameter.
annotation.comment: Usually an organization, but may be an individual. This item SHOULD be populated unless the information is available from context.
annotation.requirements: Helps establish the "authority/credibility" of the search parameter. May also allow for contact.

annotation.definition: Contacts to assist a user in finding and communicating with the publisher.
annotation.comment: May be a web site, an email address, a telephone number (tel:), etc.

annotation.shortDefinition: Why this search parameter is defined
annotation.definition: The Scope and Usage that this search parameter was created to meet.
The status of this search parameter definition.
annotation.comment: This is not intended for use with actual conformance statements, but where conformance statements are used to describe possible or desired systems.

annotation.shortDefinition: If for testing purposes, not real usage
annotation.definition: A flag to indicate that this search parameter definition is authored for testing purposes (or education/evaluation/marketing), and is not intended to be used for genuine usage.
annotation.comment: Allows filtering of search parameter definitions that are appropriate for use vs. not.

annotation.definition: The date (and optionally time) when the search parameter definition was published.

annotation.shortDefinition: The resource type this search parameter applies to
annotation.definition: The base resource type that this search parameter refers to.

annotation.shortDefinition: number | date | string | token | reference | composite | quantity | uri
annotation.definition: The type of value a search parameter refers to, and how the content is interpreted.
A description of the search parameters and how it used.
An XPath expression that returns a set of elements for the search parameter.
annotation.comment: Note that the elements returned by the XPath are sometimes complex elements where logic is required to determine quite how to handle them. E.g. CodeableConcepts may contain text and/or multiple codings, where the codings themselves contain a code and a system.

annotation.shortDefinition: Types of resource (if a resource reference)
annotation.definition: Types of resource (if a resource is referenced).

example.name: General
example.description: General example for searching on an extension

example.name: Extension
example.description: Search parameter for an extension example

search.name: description
search.description: Documentation for search parameter

search.name: name
search.description: Name of search parameter

search.name: target
search.description: Types of resource (if a resource reference)

search.name: base
search.description: The resource type this search parameter applies to

search.name: type
search.description: number | date | string | token | reference | composite | quantity | uri

search.name: url
search.description: Literal URL used to reference this search parameter

annotations.shortDefinition: A slot of time on a schedule that may be available for booking appointments
annotations.definition: A slot of time on a schedule that may be available for booking appointments.

binding.name: SlotStatus
binding.definition: The free/busy status of a slot

code.definition: Indicates that the time interval is busy because one or more events have been scheduled for that interval.
Indicates that the time interval is free for scheduling.
Indicates that the time interval is busy and that the interval can not be scheduled.
code.display: B U S Y U N A V A I L A B L E

code.definition: Indicates that the time interval is busy because one or more events have been tentatively scheduled for that interval.
code.display: B U S Y T E N T A T I V E

annotation.definition: External Ids for this item.

annotation.shortDefinition: The type of appointments that can be booked into this slot (ideally this would be an identifiable service - which is at a location, rather than the location itself). If provided then this overrides the value provided on the availability resource
annotation.definition: The type of appointments that can be booked into this slot (ideally this would be an identifiable service - which is at a location, rather than the location itself). If provided then this overrides the value provided on the availability resource.

annotation.shortDefinition: The schedule resource that this slot defines an interval of status information
annotation.definition: The schedule resource that this slot defines an interval of status information.
BUSY | FREE | BUSY-UNAVAILABLE | BUSY-TENTATIVE.
annotation.committeeNotes: This is not a modifier element as the status of the slot being busy is not a change in the interpretation of the slot.

annotation.shortDefinition: Date/Time that the slot is to begin
annotation.definition: Date/Time that the slot is to begin.

annotation.shortDefinition: Date/Time that the slot is to conclude
annotation.definition: Date/Time that the slot is to conclude.

annotation.shortDefinition: This slot has already been overbooked, appointments are unlikely to be accepted for this time
annotation.definition: This slot has already been overbooked, appointments are unlikely to be accepted for this time.

annotation.shortDefinition: Comments on the slot to describe any extended information. Such as custom constraints on the slot
annotation.definition: Comments on the slot to describe any extended information. Such as custom constraints on the slot.

example.name: Free Example
example.description: Example of an available slot (no appointments allocated)

example.name: Busy Example
example.description: Example for a slot that has an appointment allocated to it

example.name: Unavailable Example
example.description: Example of a slot that has been marked as unavailable

search.name: schedule
search.description: The Schedule Resource that we are seeking a slot within

search.name: start
search.description: Appointment date/time.

search.name: slottype
search.description: The type of appointments that can be booked into the slot

search.name: fbtype
search.description: The free/busy status of the appointment

annotations.shortDefinition: Sample for analysis
annotations.definition: Sample for analysis.
A nested type in Specimen: Details concerning the specimen collection.

annotation.definition: Person who collected the specimen.
To communicate any details or issues encountered during the specimen collection procedure.
Time when specimen was collected from subject - the physiologically relevant time.
The quantity of specimen collected; for instance the volume of a blood sample, or the physical measurement of an anatomic pathology sample.
A coded value specifying the technique that is used to perform the procedure.
Anatomical location from which the specimen was collected (if subject is a patient). This is the target site. This element is not used for environmental specimens.

annotations.definition: A nested type in Specimen: Details concerning treatment and processing steps for the specimen.

annotation.definition: Textual description of procedure.

annotation.shortDefinition: Indicates the treatment or processing step applied to the specimen
annotation.definition: A coded value specifying the procedure used to process the specimen.

annotation.shortDefinition: Material used in the processing step
annotation.definition: Material used in the processing step.

annotations.definition: A nested type in Specimen: The container holding the specimen. The recursive nature of containers; i.e. blood in tube in tray in rack is not addressed here.

annotation.definition: Id for container. There may be multiple; a manufacturer's bar code, lab assigned identifier, etc. The container ID may differ from the specimen id in some circumstances.
Textual description of the container.

annotation.shortDefinition: Kind of container directly associated with specimen
annotation.definition: The type of container associated with the specimen (e.g. slide, aliquot, etc).
The capacity (volume or other measure) the container may contain.
annotation.v2Mapping: one of: SAC 16, SAC17 and SAC 20, or SAC 21 and SAC 20

annotation.definition: The quantity of specimen in the container; may be volume, dimensions, or other appropriate measurements, depending on the specimen type.
Introduced substance to preserve, maintain or enhance the specimen. examples: Formalin, Citrate, EDTA.

binding.name: SpecimenCollectionMethod
binding.definition: The technique that is used to perform the procedure

binding.name: SpecimenTreatmentProcedure
binding.definition: Type indicating the technique used to process the specimen

binding.name: SpecimenContainerAdditive
binding.definition: Substance added to specimen container

binding.name: SpecimenType
binding.definition: The type of the specimen.

binding.name: SpecimenContainerType
binding.definition: Type of specimen container

annotation.definition: Id for specimen.

annotation.shortDefinition: Kind of material that forms the specimen
annotation.definition: The kind of material that forms the specimen.
annotation.comment: The type can change the way that a specimen is handled, and drives what kind of analyses can properly be performed on the specimen. It is frequently used in diagnostic work flow decision making systems.

annotation.shortDefinition: Specimen from which this specimen originated
annotation.definition: Reference to the parent (source) specimen which is used when the specimen was either derived from or a component of a another specimen.
annotation.comment: The parent specimen could be the source from which the current specimen is derived by some processing step (e.g. an aliquot or isolate or extracted nucleic acids from clinical samples) or one of many specimens that were combined to create a pooled sample.

annotation.shortDefinition: Where the specimen came from. This may be from the patient(s) or from the environment or a device
annotation.definition: Where the specimen came from. This may be from the patient(s) or from the environment or a device.
annotation.requirements: Must know the subject context.

annotation.definition: The identifier assigned by the lab when accessioning specimen(s). This is not necessarily the same as the specimen identifier, depending on local lab procedures.

annotation.shortDefinition: The time when specimen was received for processing
annotation.definition: Time when specimen was received for processing or testing.
Details concerning the specimen collection.
Details concerning treatment and processing steps for the specimen.
The container holding the specimen. The recursive nature of containers; i.e. blood in tube in tray in rack is not addressed here.

example.name: USLab Specimen Example1
example.description: USLab Specimen Profile Canonical Example: Blood

search.name: collector
search.description: Who collected the specimen

search.name: patient
search.description: The patient the specimen comes from

search.name: site-code
search.description: The code for the body site from where the specimen originated

search.name: container
search.description: The kind of specimen container

search.name: collected
search.description: The date the specimen was collected

search.name: subject
search.description: The subject of the specimen

search.name: containerid
search.description: The unique identifier associated with the specimen container

search.name: site-reference
search.description: BodySite resource for the body site from where the specimen originated

search.name: accession
search.description: The accession number associated with the specimen

search.name: parent
search.description: The parent of the specimen

search.name: type
search.description: The specimen type

search.name: identifier
search.description: The unique identifier associated with the specimen

annotations.shortDefinition: Structural Definition
annotations.definition: A definition of a FHIR structure. This resource is used to describe the underlying resources, data types defined in FHIR, and also for describing extensions, and constraints on resources and data types.
A nested type in StructureDefinition: Contacts to assist a user in finding and communicating with the publisher.

annotation.shortDefinition: Name of a individual to contact
annotation.definition: The name of an individual to contact regarding the structure definition.
annotation.comment: If there is no named individual, the telecom is for the organization as a whole.

annotation.shortDefinition: Contact details for individual or publisher
annotation.definition: Contact details for individual (if a name was provided) or the publisher.

annotations.definition: A nested type in StructureDefinition: A differential view is expressed relative to the base StructureDefinition - a statement of differences that it applies.

annotation.shortDefinition: Definition of elements in the resource (if no StructureDefinition)
annotation.definition: Captures constraints on each element within the resource.

annotations.definition: A nested type in StructureDefinition: A snapshot view is expressed in a stand alone form that can be used and interpreted without considering the base StructureDefinition.

annotation.shortDefinition: Definition of elements in the resource (if no StructureDefinition)
annotation.definition: Captures constraints on each element within the resource.

annotations.definition: A nested type in StructureDefinition: An external specification that the content is mapped to.

annotation.shortDefinition: Internal id when this mapping is used
annotation.definition: An Internal id that is used to identify this mapping set when specific mappings are made.
annotation.comment: The specification is described once, with general comments, and then specific mappings are made that reference this declaration.

annotation.shortDefinition: Identifies what this mapping refers to
annotation.definition: An absolute URI that identifies the specification that this mapping is expressed to.
annotation.comment: A formal identity for the specification being mapped to helps with identifying maps consistently.

annotation.shortDefinition: Names what this mapping refers to
annotation.definition: A name for the specification that is being mapped to.
Comments about this mapping, including version notes, issues, scope limitations, and other important notes for usage.

binding.name: StructureDefinitionType
binding.definition: Defines the type of structure that a definition is describing

code.definition: A data type - either a primitive or complex structure that defines a set of data elements. These can be used throughout Resource and extension definitions.
A resource defined by the FHIR specification.
A set of constraints on a resource or data type that describe how it is used for a particular use.
A definition of an extension that can be used in a FHIR resource (or a set of constraints on an exsting extension).

binding.name: ExtensionContext
binding.definition: How an extension context is interpreted

code.definition: The context is all elements matching a particular resource element path.
The context is all nodes matching a particular data type element path (root or repeating element) or all elements referencing a particular primitive data type (expressed as the datatype name).

The context is all nodes whose mapping to a specified reference model corresponds to a particular mapping structure. The context identifies the mapping target. The mapping should clearly identify where such an extension could be used.
The context is a particular extension from a particular profile. Expressed as uri#name, where uri identifies the profile and #name identifies the extension code.

annotation.shortDefinition: Literal URL used to reference this StructureDefinition
annotation.definition: An absolute URL at which this StructureDefinition is (or will be) published, and which is used to reference this StructureDefinition in extension urls and tag values in operational FHIR systems.
annotation.requirements: So you can say, in a StructureDefinition, what the full extensions URLs should be. This is required to allow hosting StructureDefinitions on multiple different servers, and to allow for the editorial process.

annotation.definition: Formal identifier that is used to identify this StructureDefinition when it is represented in other formats, or referenced in a specification, model, design or an instance (should be globally unique OID, UUID, or URI), (if it's not possible to use the literal URI).

annotation.shortDefinition: Logical id for this version of the StructureDefinition
annotation.definition: The identifier that is used to identify this version of the StructureDefinition when it is referenced in a specification, model, design or instance. This is an arbitrary value managed by the StructureDefinition author manually.
annotation.requirements: There may be multiple resource versions of the StructureDefinition that have this same identifier. The resource version id will change for technical reasons, whereas the stated version number needs to be under the author's control.

annotation.definition: A free text natural language name identifying the StructureDefinition.
annotation.comment: Not expected to be globally unique.

annotation.shortDefinition: Content intends to support these contexts
annotation.definition: The content was developed with a focus and intent of supporting the contexts that are listed. These terms may be used to assist with indexing and searching of structure definitions.
annotation.requirements: Assist in searching for appropriate content.

annotation.shortDefinition: Use this name when displaying the value
annotation.definition: Defined so that applications can use this name when displaying the value of the extension to the user.
annotation.comment: Applications don't have to use this name, but can always fall back to it. In the absence of a value for this element, use the name.

annotation.shortDefinition: Name of the publisher (Organization or individual)
annotation.definition: The name of the individual or organization that published the structure definition.
annotation.comment: Usually an organization, but may be an individual. This item SHOULD be populated unless the information is available from context.
annotation.requirements: Helps establish the "authority/credibility" of the structure definition. May also allow for contact.

annotation.definition: Contacts to assist a user in finding and communicating with the publisher.
annotation.comment: May be a web site, an email address, a telephone number (tel:), etc.

annotation.shortDefinition: Natural language description of the StructureDefinition
annotation.definition: A free text natural language description of the StructureDefinition and its use.
annotation.comment: This field can be used for things such as why the StructureDefinition was written, comments about misuse, instructions for clinical use and interpretation, literature references, examples from the paper world, etc. It is *not* a rendering of the StructureDefinition as conveyed in StructureDefinition.text. This item SHOULD be populated unless the information is available from context.

annotation.shortDefinition: Scope and Usage this structure definition is for
annotation.definition: Explains why this structure definition is needed and why it's been constrained as it has.
annotation.comment: This element does not describe the usage of the structure definition (that's done in comments), rather it's for traceability of *why* the element is either needed or why the constraints exist as they do. This may be used to point to source materials or specifications that drove the structure of this data element.

annotation.definition: A copyright statement relating to the structure definition and/or its contents. Copyright statements are generally legal restrictions on the use and publishing of the details of the constraints and mappings.
A set of terms from external terminologies that may be used to assist with indexing and searching of templates.
annotation.requirements: Assist in searching for appropriate StructureDefinitions.

annotation.definition: The status of the StructureDefinition.
annotation.requirements: Allows filtering of StructureDefinitions that are appropriate for use vs. not.

annotation.shortDefinition: If for testing purposes, not real usage
annotation.definition: This StructureDefinition was authored for testing purposes (or education/evaluation/marketing), and is not intended to be used for genuine usage.
annotation.requirements: Allows filtering of StructureDefinitions that are appropriate for use vs. not.

annotation.shortDefinition: Date for this version of the StructureDefinition
annotation.definition: The date that this version of the StructureDefinition was published.

The version of the FHIR specification on which this StructureDefinition is based - this is the formal version of the specification, without the revision number, e.g. [publication].[major].[minor], which is 0.4.0 for this version.
annotation.comment: A StructureDefinition does not need to specify the target it applies to,as StructureDefinitions will often be valid across multiple versions of FHIR. FHIR tooling can determine whether a StructureDefinition is consistent with a particular StructureDefinition if desired.

annotation.shortDefinition: External specification that the content is mapped to
annotation.definition: An external specification that the content is mapped to.
Defines the type of structure that this definition is describing.
Whether structure this definition describes is abstract or not - that is, whether an actual exchanged item can ever be of this type.
annotation.comment: Abstract Resources cannot be instantiated - a concrete sub-type must be used. Abstract datatypes and extensions cannot be used in an instance. Flagging a constraint structure as abstract conveys design intent but makes no difference to how the structure definition is handled. Note that inline declared elements that are given the type "Element" in the profile, but have children described, are anonymous concrete types that specialise Element.

annotation.definition: If this is an extension, Identifies the context within FHIR resources where the extension can be used.

annotation.shortDefinition: Where the extension can be used in instances
annotation.definition: Identifies the types of resource or data type elements to which the extension can be applied.
annotation.comment: If the context is an element that can have multiple types, then use (e.g.) value[x] if the extension works on all choice types, or otherwise an enumeration of explicitly named elements if not. Note that a context of "string" doesn't mean that the extension can be used with one of the string patterns such as "id" etc.

annotation.shortDefinition: Structure that this set of constraints applies to
annotation.definition: An absolute URI that is the base structure from which this set of constraints is derived.
annotation.comment: If differential constraints are specified in this structure, they are applied to the base in a "differential" fashion. If there is no base, then the differential constraints cannot be provided (snapshot only). Differential structures are useful for the editing perspective, and snapshot structures are suitable for operational use. The FHIR Project provides a number of tools/services to populate snaphots from differential constraints.

annotation.definition: A snapshot view is expressed in a stand alone form that can be used and interpreted without considering the base StructureDefinition.
A differential view is expressed relative to the base StructureDefinition - a statement of differences that it applies.

invariant.name: sdf-5
invariant.human: If the type is 'extension' then the structure must have context information

invariant.name: sdf-4
invariant.human: A structure must have a base unless it’s type is 'abstract'

invariant.name: sdf-7
invariant.human: If the type is Resource or Type, the url has to start with "http://hl7.org/fhir/StructureDefinition/" and the tail must match the name

invariant.name: sdf-6
invariant.human: A structure must have either a differential, or a snapshot (or both)

invariant.name: sdf-8
invariant.human: In any snapshot or differential, all the elements except the first have to have a path that starts with the path of the first + "."
invariant.xpath: string-join(for $elementName in f:*[self::f:snapshot or self::f:differential]/f:element[position()>1]/f:path/@value return if (starts-with($elementName, concat($elementName/ancestor::f:element/parent::f:*/f:element[1]/f:path/@value, '.'))) then '' else $elementName,'')=''

search.name: abstract
search.description: Whether the structure is abstract

search.name: status
search.description: The current status of the profile

search.name: experimental
search.description: If for testing purposes, not real usage

search.name: display
search.description: Use this name when displaying the value

search.name: ext-context
search.description: Where the extension can be used in instances

search.name: code
search.description: A code for the profile

search.name: date
search.description: The profile publication date

search.name: type
search.description: type | resource | constraint | extension

search.name: url
search.description: Literal URL used to reference this StructureDefinition

search.name: version
search.description: The version identifier of the profile

search.name: publisher
search.description: Name of the publisher of the profile

search.name: valueset
search.description: A vocabulary binding reference

search.name: context-type
search.description: resource | datatype | mapping | extension

search.name: description
search.description: Text search in the description of the profile

search.name: name
search.description: Name of the profile

search.name: base
search.description: Structure that this set of constraints applies to

search.name: context
search.description: A use context assigned to the structure

search.name: path
search.description: A path that is constrained in the profile

search.name: identifier
search.description: The identifier of the profile

annotations.shortDefinition: A server push subscription criteria
annotations.definition: The subscription resource is used to define a push based subscription from a server to another system. Once a subscription is registered with the server, the server checks every resource that is created or updated, and if the resource matches the given criteria, it sends a message on the defined "channel" so that another system is able to take an appropriate action.
A nested type in Subscription: Details where to send notifications when resources are received that meet the criteria.

annotation.definition: The type of channel to send notififcations on.
The uri that describes tha actual end point to send messages to.
annotation.comment: For rest-hook, and websocket, the end point must be an http: or https URL; for email, a mailto: url, for sms, a tel: url, and for message the endpoint can be in any form of url the server understands (usually, http: or mllp:). The URI is allowed to be relative; in which case, it is relative to the server end-point (since their may be more than one, clients should avoid using relative URIs).

annotation.shortDefinition: Mimetype to send, or blank for no payload
annotation.definition: The mime type to send the payload in - either application/xml+fhir, or application/json+fhir. If the mime type is blank, then there is no payload in the notification, just a notification.
annotation.comment: Sending the payload has obvious security consequences. The server is responsible for ensuring that the content is appropriately secured.

annotation.shortDefinition: Usage depends on the channel type
annotation.definition: Additional headers / information to send as part of the notification.
annotation.comment: Exactly what these mean depend on the channel type. The can convey additional information to the recipient and/or meet security requirements.

binding.name: SubscriptionStatus
binding.definition: The status of a subscription

code.definition: The client has requested the subscription, and the server has not yet set it up.
The subscription is active.
The server has an error executing the notification.
Too many errors have occurred or the subscription has expired.

binding.name: SubscriptionChannelType
binding.definition: The type of method used to execute a subscription

code.definition: The channel is executed by making a post to the URI. If a payload is included, the URL is interpreted as the service base, and an update (PUT) is made.
The channel is executed by sending a packet across a web socket connection maintained by the client. The URL identifies the websocket, and the client binds to this URL.
The channel is executed by sending an email to the email addressed in the URI (which must be a mailto:).
The channel is executed by sending an SMS message to the phone number identified in the URL (tel:).
The channel Is executed by sending a message (e.g. a Bundle with a MessageHeader resource etc) to the application identified in the URI.

annotation.definition: The rules that the server should use to determine when to generate notifications for this subscription.
annotation.comment: The rules are a search criteria (without the [base] part.

annotation.definition: Contact details for a human to contact about the subscription. The primary use of this for system administrator troubleshooting.

annotation.shortDefinition: Description of why this subscription was created
annotation.definition: A description of why this subscription is defined.
The status of the subscription, which marks the server state for managing the subscription.
annotation.comment: A client can only submit subscription resources in the requested or off state. Only the server can move a subscription from requested to active, and then to error. Either the server or the client can turn a subscription off.

annotation.definition: A record of the last error that occurred when the server processed a notification.

annotation.shortDefinition: The channel on which to report matches to the criteria
annotation.definition: Details where to send notifications when resources are received that meet the criteria.

annotation.shortDefinition: When to automatically delete the subscription
annotation.definition: The time for the server to turn the subscription off.
annotation.comment: The server is permitted to deviate from this time, but should observe it.

annotation.shortDefinition: A tag to add to matching resources
annotation.definition: A tag to add to any resource that matches the criteria, after the subscription is processed.
annotation.comment: So that other systems can tell which resources have been the subject of a notification.

search.name: criteria
search.description: Rule for server push criteria

search.name: status
search.description: requested | active | error | off

search.name: tag
search.description: A tag to add to matching resources

search.name: payload
search.description: Mimetype to send, or blank for no payload

search.name: type
search.description: rest-hook | websocket | email | sms | message

search.name: contact
search.description: Contact details for source (e.g. troubleshooting)

search.name: url
search.description: Where the channel points to

annotations.shortDefinition: A homogeneous material with a definite composition
annotations.definition: A homogeneous material with a definite composition.
A nested type in Substance: A substance can be composed of other substances.

annotation.definition: The amount of the ingredient in the substance - a concentration ratio.
Another substance that is a component of this substance.

annotations.definition: A nested type in Substance: Substance may be used to describe a kind of substance, or a specific package/container of the substance: an instance.

annotation.definition: Identifier associated with the package/container (usually a label affixed directly).

annotation.shortDefinition: When no longer valid to use
annotation.definition: When the substance is no longer valid to use. For some substances, a single arbitrary date is used for expiry.

annotation.shortDefinition: Amount of substance in the package
annotation.definition: The amount of the substance.

binding.name: SubstanceType
binding.definition: Type of the substance

annotation.shortDefinition: What kind of substance this is
annotation.definition: A code (or set of codes) that identify this substance.
annotation.comment: This could be a reference to an externally defined code. It could also be a locally assigned code (e.g. a formulary), optionally with translations to the standard drug codes.

annotation.shortDefinition: Textual description of the substance, comments
annotation.definition: A description of the substance - its appearance, handling requirements, and other usage notes.

annotation.shortDefinition: If this describes a specific package/container of the substance
annotation.definition: Substance may be used to describe a kind of substance, or a specific package/container of the substance: an instance.
A substance can be composed of other substances.

search.name: substance
search.description: A component of the substance

search.name: quantity
search.description: Amount of substance in the package

search.name: type
search.description: The type of the substance

search.name: identifier
search.description: Identifier of the package/container

search.name: expiry
search.description: When no longer valid to use

annotations.shortDefinition: A supply - request and provision
annotations.definition: A supply - a request for something, and provision of what is supplied.
A nested type in Supply: Indicates the details of the dispense event such as the days supply and quantity of a supply dispensed.

annotation.definition: Identifier assigned by the dispensing facility when the item(s) is dispensed.
annotation.comment: This is assigned by the dispenser, and used to refer to this order in other external standards.

annotation.definition: A code specifying the state of the dispense event.
Indicates the type of dispensing event that is performed. Examples include: Trial Fill, Completion of Trial, Partial Fill, Emergency Fill, Samples, etc.
The amount of supply that has been dispensed. Includes unit of measure.

Identifies the medication or substance or device being dispensed. This is either a link to a resource representing the details of the item or a simple attribute carrying a code that identifies the item from a known list.
The individual responsible for dispensing the medication, supplier or device.
The time the dispense event occurred.
The time the dispensed item was sent or handed to the patient (or agent).
Identification of the facility/location where the Supply was shipped to, as part of the dispense event.
Identifies the person who picked up the Supply.

binding.name: SupplyDispenseStatus
binding.definition: Status of the dispense

code.definition: Supply has been requested, but not dispensed.
Supply is part of a pharmacy order and has been dispensed.
Dispensing was not completed.

binding.name: SupplyItemType
binding.definition: The actual item being supplied

binding.name: SupplyStatus
binding.definition: Status of the supply

code.definition: Supply has been requested, but not dispensed.
Supply is part of a pharmacy order and has been dispensed.
Supply has been received by the requestor.
The supply will not be completed because the supplier was unable or unwilling to supply the item.
The orderer of the supply cancelled the request.

binding.name: SupplyKind
binding.definition: Category of supply

annotation.shortDefinition: The kind of supply (central, non-stock, etc)
annotation.definition: Category of supply, e.g. central, non-stock, etc. This is used to support work flows associated with the supply process.
Unique identifier for this supply request.
annotation.comment: This is assigned by the orderer, and used to refer to this order in other external standards.

annotation.definition: Status of the supply request.

annotation.shortDefinition: Medication, Substance, or Device requested to be supplied
annotation.definition: The item that is requested to be supplied.
annotation.comment: Note that there's a difference between a prescription - an instruction to take a medication, along with a (sometimes) implicit supply, and an explicit request to supply, with no explicit instructions.

annotation.shortDefinition: Patient for whom the item is supplied
annotation.definition: A link to a resource representing the person whom the ordered item is for.
Indicates the details of the dispense event such as the days supply and quantity of a supply dispensed.

search.name: patient
search.description: Patient for whom the item is supplied

search.name: status
search.description: requested | dispensed | received | failed | cancelled

search.name: dispenseid
search.description: External identifier

search.name: identifier
search.description: Unique identifier

search.name: kind
search.description: The kind of supply (central, non-stock, etc)

search.name: dispensestatus
search.description: in-progress | dispensed | abandoned

annotations.shortDefinition: Documentation submission
annotations.definition: This resource provides the supporting information for a process, for example clinical or financial information related to a claim or pre-authorization.
A nested type in SupportingDocumentation: Supporting Files.

annotation.definition: A link Id for the response to reference.
The attached content.
The date and optionally time when the material was created.
The Response Business Identifier.
The version of the style of resource contents. This should be mapped to the allowable profiles for this and supporting resources.
The style (standard) and version of the original material which was converted into this resource.
annotation.requirements: Knowledge of the original version can inform the processing of this instance so that information which is processable by the originating system may be generated.

annotation.definition: The date when this resource was created.
The Insurer, organization or Provider who is target of the submission.
The practitioner who is responsible for the services rendered to the patient.
The organization which is responsible for the services rendered to the patient.
Original request.
annotation.comment: changed name from number to identifier.

annotation.definition: Original response.
annotation.comment: changed name from number to identifier.

annotation.definition: Person who created the submission.
The patient who is directly or indirectly the subject of the supporting information.
Supporting Files.

search.name: author
search.description: The person who generated this resource

search.name: patient
search.description: The patient to whom the documents refer

search.name: subject
search.description: The patient to whom the documents refer

search.name: identifier
search.description: The business identifier of the Eligibility

annotations.shortDefinition: A set of codes drawn from one or more code systems
annotations.definition: A value set specifies a set of codes drawn from one or more code systems.
A nested type in ValueSet: A definition of an code system, inlined into the value set.

annotation.shortDefinition: URI to identify the code system
annotation.definition: An absolute URI that is used to reference this code system, including in [Coding]{datatypes.html#Coding}.system.

The version of this code system that defines the codes. Note that the version is optional because a well maintained code system does not suffer from versioning, and therefore the version does not need to be maintained. However many code systems are not well maintained, and the version needs to be defined and tracked.

annotation.shortDefinition: If code comparison is case sensitive
annotation.definition: If code comparison is case sensitive when codes within this system are compared to each other.
annotation.comment: If this value is missing, then it is not specified whether a code system is case sensitive or not. When the rule is not known, Postel's law should be followed: produce codes with the correct case, and accept codes in any case. This element is primarily provided to support validation software.

annotation.definition: Concepts in the code system.

annotations.definition: A nested type in ValueSet: The codes that are contained in the value set expansion.

annotation.definition: An absolute URI which is the code system in which the code for this item in the expansion is defined.

annotation.shortDefinition: If user cannot select this entry
annotation.definition: If true, this entry is included in the expansion for navigational purposes, and the user cannot select the code directly as a proper value.
annotation.comment: This shouldn't be understood to exclude its use for searchig (e..g by subsumption testing). The client should know whether it is appropriate for the user to select an abstract code or not.

annotation.shortDefinition: Version in which this code / display is defined
annotation.definition: The version of this code system that defined this code and/or display. This should only be used with code systems that do not enforce concept permanence.
annotation.comment: The exact value of the version string is specified by the system from which the code is derived.

annotation.shortDefinition: Code - if blank, this is not a choosable code
annotation.definition: Code - if blank, this is not a choosable code.
User display for the concept.
Codes contained in this concept.

annotations.definition: A nested type in ValueSet: Additional representations for the concept - other languages, aliases, specialised purposes, used for particular purposes, etc.

annotation.definition: The language this designation is defined for.
annotation.comment: In the absense of a language, the resource language applies.

annotation.shortDefinition: Details how this designation would be used
annotation.definition: A code that details how this designation would be used.
annotation.comment: if no use is provided, the designation can be assumed to be suitable for general display to a human user.

annotation.shortDefinition: The text value for this designation
annotation.definition: The text value for this designation.

annotations.definition: A nested type in ValueSet: Concepts in the code system.

annotation.definition: Code that identifies concept.

annotation.shortDefinition: If this code is not for use as a real concept
annotation.definition: If this code is not for use as a real concept.

annotation.shortDefinition: Text to Display to the user
annotation.definition: Text to Display to the user.

The formal definition of the concept. Formal definitions are not required, because of the prevalence of legacy systems without them, but they are highly recommended, as without them there is no formal meaning associated with the concept.
Additional representations for the concept - other languages, aliases, specialised purposes, used for particular purposes, etc.
annotation.requirements: many concept definition systems support mltiple representations, in multiple languages, and for mltiple purposes.

annotation.definition: Child Concepts (is-a / contains).

annotations.definition: A nested type in ValueSet: Include one or more codes from a code system.

annotation.shortDefinition: The system the codes come from
annotation.definition: An absolute URI which is the code system from which the selected codes come from.
annotation.comment: See *Coding.system* for further documentation.

annotation.shortDefinition: Specific version of the code system referred to
annotation.definition: The version of the code system that the codes are selected from.
annotation.comment: This is used when selecting the descendents of a concept - they may change between versions. If no version is specified, then the exact contents of the value set may not be known until a context of use binds it to a particular version.

annotation.shortDefinition: A concept defined in the system
annotation.definition: Specifies a concept to be included or excluded.
annotation.comment: The list of concepts is considered ordered, though the order may not have any particular significance. Typically, the order an an expansion follows that defined in the compose.

annotation.shortDefinition: Select codes/concepts by their properties (including relationships)
annotation.definition: Select concepts by specify a matching criteria based on the properties (including relationships) defined by the system. If multiple filters are specified, they SHALL all be true.
annotation.comment: Selecting codes by specifying filters based on properties is only possible where the underlying code system defines appropriate properties. Note that in some cases, the underlying code system defines the logical concepts but not the literal codes for the concepts. In such cases, the literal definitions may be provided by a third party.

annotations.definition: A nested type in ValueSet: Specifies a concept to be included or excluded.

annotation.definition: Specifies a code for the concept to be included or excluded.
annotation.comment: Expressions are allowed if defined by the underlying code system.

annotation.shortDefinition: Test to display for this code for this value set
annotation.definition: The text to display to the user for this concept in the context of this valueset. If no display is provided, then applications using the value set use the display specified for the code by the system.
annotation.comment: The value set resource allows for an alternative display to be specified for when this concept is used in this particular value set. See notes in the value set narrative about the correct use of this element.

annotation.definition: Additional representations for this concept when used in this value set - other languages, aliases, specialised purposes, used for particular purposes, etc.

annotations.definition: A nested type in ValueSet: Select concepts by specify a matching criteria based on the properties (including relationships) defined by the system. If multiple filters are specified, they SHALL all be true.

annotation.shortDefinition: A property defined by the code system
annotation.definition: A code that identifies a property defined in the code system.
The kind of operation to perform as a part of the filter criteria.

annotation.shortDefinition: Code from the system, or regex criteria
annotation.definition: The match value may be either a code defined by the system, or a string value which is used a regex match on the literal string of the property value.
annotation.comment: Use regex matching with care - full regex matching on every SNOMED CT term is prohibitive, for example.

annotations.definition: A nested type in ValueSet: Contacts to assist a user in finding and communicating with the publisher.

annotation.shortDefinition: Name of a individual to contact
annotation.definition: The name of an individual to contact regarding the value set.
annotation.comment: If there is no named individual, the telecom is for the organization as a whole.

annotation.shortDefinition: Contact details for individual or publisher
annotation.definition: Contact details for individual (if a name was provided) or the publisher.

annotations.definition: A nested type in ValueSet: A Parameter that controlled the expansion process. These paameters may be used by users of expanded value sets to check whether the expansion is suitable for a particular purpose, or to pick the correct expansion.

annotation.definition: The name of the parameter.
annotation.comment: The names are assigned at the discretion of the server.

annotation.definition: The value of the parameter.

annotations.definition: A nested type in ValueSet: When value set includes codes from elsewhere.

annotation.shortDefinition: Import the contents of another value set
annotation.definition: Includes the contents of the referenced value set as a part of the contents of this value set. This is an absolute URI that is a reference to ValueSet.uri.
annotation.comment: The value set URI is either a logical reference to a defined value set such as a [SNOMED CT reference set]{snomedct.html#implicit}, or a direct reference to a value set definition using ValueSet.url. The reference may also not reference a actual FHIR value set resource; in this case, whatever is referenced is an implicit definition of a value set that needs to be clear about how versions are resolved.

annotation.shortDefinition: Include one or more codes from a code system
annotation.definition: Include one or more codes from a code system.
annotation.comment: If there are no codes or filters, the entire code system is included. Note that the set of codes hat are included may contain abstract codes.

annotation.definition: Exclude one or more codes from the value set.
annotation.comment: Usually this is used to selectively exclude codes that were included by subsumption in the inclusions. Any display names specified for the codes are ignored.

annotations.definition: A nested type in ValueSet: A value set can also be "expanded", where the value set is turned into a simple collection of enumerated codes. This element holds the expansion, if it has been performed.

annotation.definition: An identifier that uniquely identifies this expansion of the valueset. Systems may re-use the same identifier as long as the expansion and the definition remain the same, but are not required to do so.
annotation.comment: Typically, this uri is a UUID (e.g. urn:uuid:8230ff20-c97a-4167-a59d-dc2cb9df16dd).

annotation.definition: The time at which the expansion was produced by the expanding system.
annotation.comment: This SHOULD have be a fully populated instant, but in some circumstances, value sets are expanded by hand, of the expansion is published without that precision.

annotation.shortDefinition: Parameter that controlled the expansion process
annotation.definition: A Parameter that controlled the expansion process. These paameters may be used by users of expanded value sets to check whether the expansion is suitable for a particular purpose, or to pick the correct expansion.
annotation.comment: The server decides which parameters to include here, but as a minimum, the list SHOULD include the date, filter, and profile parameters passed to the $expand operation (if any).

annotation.definition: The codes that are contained in the value set expansion.

binding.name: ConceptDesignationUse
binding.definition: Details of how a designation would be used

binding.name: FilterOperator
binding.definition: The kind of operation to perform as a part of a property based filter

code.definition: The specified property of the code equals the provided value.
Includes all concept ids that have a transitive is-a relationship with the concept Id provided as the value, including the provided concept itself.
The specified property of the code does not have an is-a relationship with the provided value.
The specified property of the code matches the regex specified in the provided value.
The specified property of the code is in the set of codes or concepts specified in the provided value (comma separated list).
The specified property of the code is not in the set of codes or concepts specified in the provided value (comma separated list).

annotation.shortDefinition: Globally unique logical id for value set
annotation.definition: An absolute uri that is used to identify this value set when it is referenced in a specification, model, design or an instance (should be globally unique URI, and an be urn:uuid: or urn:oid:).

annotation.shortDefinition: Additional identifier for the value set (v2 / CDA)
annotation.definition: Formal identifier that is used to identify this value set when it is represented in other formats, or referenced in a specification, model, design or an instance.
annotation.comment: Typically, this is used for values that can go in a v3 II data type.

annotation.shortDefinition: Logical id for this version of the value set
annotation.definition: Used to identify this version of the value set when it is referenced in a specification, model, design or instance. This is an arbitrary value managed by the profile author manually and the value should be a timestamp.
annotation.comment: There may be multiple resource versions of the value set that have the same identifier.

annotation.shortDefinition: Informal name for this value set
annotation.definition: A free text natural language name describing the value set.
annotation.comment: The name is not expected to be unique. A name should be provided unless the value set is a contained resource (e.g. an anonymous value set in a profile). Most registries will require a name.
annotation.requirements: Support human navigation.

annotation.shortDefinition: Content intends to support these contexts
annotation.definition: The content was developed with a focus and intent of supporting the contexts that are listed. These terms may be used to assist with indexing and searching of value set definitions.
annotation.requirements: Assist in searching for appropriate content.

annotation.shortDefinition: Indicates whether or not any change to the content logical definition may occur
annotation.definition: If this is set to 'true', then no new versions of the content logical definition can be created. Note: Other metadata might still change.
annotation.comment: Normally immutability is set to 'false', which is the default assumption if it is not populated. Note that the implication is that if this is set to 'true', there may be only one Value Set Version for this Definition. Immutability tends to be set to 'true' in one of two cases: - Where the value set, by the nature of its usage, cannot change. For example "All specializations of ACT in ActClassCode" - Where there's no safe way to express the "Purpose" such that someone else could safely make changes to the value set definition Source workflow control must guarantee that the same URI always yields the same definition.

annotation.shortDefinition: Name of the publisher (Organization or individual)
annotation.definition: The name of the individual or organization that published the value set.
annotation.comment: Usually an organization, but may be an individual. This item SHOULD be populated unless the information is available from context.
annotation.requirements: Helps establish the "authority/credibility" of the value set. May also allow for contact.

annotation.definition: Contacts to assist a user in finding and communicating with the publisher.
annotation.comment: May be a web site, an email address, a telephone number (tel:), etc.

annotation.shortDefinition: Human language description of the value set
