annotation.definition: A free text natural language description of the use of the value set - reason for definition, "the semantic space" to be included in the value set, conditions of use, etc. The description may include a list of expected usages for the value set and can also describe the approach taken to build the value set.
annotation.comment: The description is not intended to describe the semantics of the Value Set - there are no intrinsic semantics separate from the codes contained in its expansion. The description should capture its intended use, which is needed for ensuring integrity for its use in models across future changes. . A description should be provided unless the value set is a contained resource (e.g. an anonymous value set in a profile). Most registries will require a description.
annotation.requirements: Human understandability.

annotation.definition: Explains why this value set is needed and why it's been constrained as it has.
annotation.comment: This element does not describe the usage of the value set (that's done in comments), rather it's for traceability of *why* the element is either needed or why the constraints exist as they do. This may be used to point to source materials or specifications that drove the structure of this data element.

annotation.definition: A copyright statement relating to the value set and/or its contents. Copyright statements are generally legal restrictions on the use and publishing of the value set.
annotation.comment: Frequently, the copyright differs between the value set, and codes that are included. The copyright statement should clearly differentiate between these when required.

annotation.definition: The status of the value set.
annotation.comment: Allows filtering of valuesets that are appropriate for use vs. not.
annotation.requirements: Identify when/if the value set should be used.

annotation.shortDefinition: If for testing purposes, not real usage
annotation.definition: This valueset was authored for testing purposes (or education/evaluation/marketing), and is not intended to be used for genuine usage.
annotation.comment: Allows filtering of valuesets that are appropriate for use vs. not.

annotation.shortDefinition: Whether this is intended to be used with an extensible binding
annotation.definition: Whether this is intended to be used with an extensible binding or not.
annotation.requirements: It is not required to say whether this intent applies.

annotation.definition: The date that the value set status was last changed.
annotation.comment: Note that this is not the same as the resource last-modified-date, since the resource may be a secondary representation of the value set.
annotation.requirements: Need to know when a value set was first legal for use or became withdrawn or replaced.

annotation.shortDefinition: Fixed date for all referenced code systems and value sets
annotation.definition: If a Locked Date is defined, then the Content Logical Definition must be evaluated using the current version of all referenced code system(s) and value sets as of the Locked Date.
annotation.comment: With a defined Locked Date the value set is considered "Locked". Otherwise, the value set may have different expansions as underlying code systems and/or value sets evolve.

annotation.shortDefinition: When value set defines its own codes
annotation.definition: A definition of an code system, inlined into the value set.
annotation.comment: All code systems defined as part of a FHIR value set have an implicit valueset that includes all the code in the code system - the value set in which they are defined.

annotation.shortDefinition: When value set includes codes from elsewhere
annotation.definition: When value set includes codes from elsewhere.

annotation.shortDefinition: Used when the value set is "expanded"
annotation.definition: A value set can also be "expanded", where the value set is turned into a simple collection of enumerated codes. This element holds the expansion, if it has been performed.
annotation.comment: Expansion is performed to produce a collection of codes that are ready to use for data entry or validation.

invariant.name: vsd-7
invariant.human: A defined code system (if present) SHALL have a different identifier to the value set itself

invariant.name: vsd-5
invariant.human: Value set SHALL contain either a define, a compose, or an expansion element

invariant.name: vsd-2
invariant.human: A value set with only one import SHALL also have an include and/or an exclude unless the value set defines its own codes
invariant.xpath: not(exists(f:compose)) or (count(f:compose/f:import)!=1 or exists(f:compose/f:include) or exists(f:compose/f:exclude) or exists(f:define))

example.name: Systems
example.description: A list of all the URIs defined in the FHIR spec

example.name: RESTful Interactions
example.description: The set of interactions defined by the RESTful part of the FHIR specification

search.name: system
search.description: The system for any codes defined by this value set

search.name: expansion
search.description: Uniquely identifies this expansion

search.name: status
search.description: The status of the value set

search.name: description
search.description: Text search in the description of the value set

search.name: name
search.description: The name of the value set

search.name: context
search.description: A use context assigned to the value set

search.name: code
search.description: A code defined in the value set

search.name: date
search.description: The value set publication date

search.name: identifier
search.description: The identifier for the value set

search.name: reference
search.description: A code system included or excluded in the value set or an imported value set

search.name: url
search.description: The logical url for the value set

search.name: publisher
search.description: Name of the publisher of the value set

search.name: version
search.description: The version identifier of the value set

annotations.shortDefinition: Prescription for Vision correction products for a patient
annotations.definition: An authorization for the supply of glasses and/or contact lenses to a patient.
A nested type in VisionPrescription: Deals with details of the dispense part of the supply specification.

annotation.definition: Identifies the type of Vision correction product which is required for the patient.
annotation.v2Mapping: RXE-2-Give Code / RXO-1-Requested Give Code / RXD-2-Dispense/Give Code

annotation.definition: The eye for which the lens applies.
Lens power measured in diopters (0.25 units).
Power adjustment for astigmatism measured in diopters (0.25 units).
Adjustment for astigmatism measured in integer degrees.
Amount of prism to compensate for eye alignment in fractional units.
The relative base, or reference lens edge, for the prism.
Power adjustment for multifocal lenses measured in diopters (0.25 units).
Contact lens power measured in diopters (0.25 units).
Back Curvature measured in millimeters.
Contact lens diameter measured in millimeters.
The recommended maximum wear period for the lens.
Special color or pattern.
Brand recommendations or restrictions.
Notes for special requirements such as coatings and lens materials.

binding.name: VisionBase
binding.definition: A coded concept listing the base codes.

code.definition: inner edge.
outer edge.

binding.name: VisionEyes
binding.definition: A coded concept listing the eye codes.

code.definition: right eye.
left eye.

binding.name: VisionProduct
binding.definition: A coded concept describing the Vision products.

annotation.definition: Business identifier which may be used by other parties to reference or identify the prescription.
annotation.v2Mapping: ORC-2-Placer Order Number / ORC-3-Filler Order Number

annotation.definition: The date (and perhaps time) when the prescription was written.
annotation.v2Mapping: RXE-32-Original Order Date/Time / ORC-9-Date/Time of Transaction

annotation.definition: A link to a resource representing the person to whom the Vision products will be supplied.
The healthcare professional responsible for authorizing the prescription.
annotation.v2Mapping: RXE-13-Ordering Provider's DEA Number / RXO-14-Ordering Provider's DEA Number / RXE-14-Pharmacist/Treatment Supplier's Verifier ID / RXO-15-Pharmacist/Treatment Supplier's Verifier ID / ORC-12-Ordering Provider / PRT-5-Participation Person: PRT-4-Participation='OP' (all but last deprecated)

annotation.definition: A link to a resource that identifies the particular occurrence of contact between patient and health care provider.

annotation.shortDefinition: Reason or indication for writing the prescription
annotation.definition: Can be the reason or the indication for writing the prescription.
Deals with details of the dispense part of the supply specification.

search.name: datewritten
search.description: Return prescriptions written on this date

search.name: patient
search.description: The identity of a patient to list dispenses for

search.name: prescriber
search.description: Who authorizes the Vision product

search.name: encounter
search.description: Return prescriptions with this encounter identity

search.name: identifier
search.description: Return prescriptions with this external identity

binding.name: AdministrativeGender
binding.definition: The gender of a person used for administrative purposes

code.comment: The gender of a person could not be uniquely defined as male or female, such as hermaphrodite

Description:A proper value is applicable, but not known. Usage Notes: This means the actual value is not known. If the only thing that is unknown is how to properly express the value in the necessary constraints (value set, datatype, etc.), then the OTH or UNC flavor should be used. No properties should be included for a datatype with this property unless: Those properties themselves directly translate to a semantic of "unknown". (E.g. a local code sent as a translation that conveys 'unknown') Those properties further qualify the nature of what is unknown. (E.g. specifying a use code of "H" and a URL prefix of "tel:" to convey that it is the home phone number that is unknown.)

binding.name: ClinicalBaseGender
binding.definition: The gender of a person used for clinical purposes . This has the same base codes as [[[AdministrativeGender]]], but is extensible to allow for finer differentiation of uncertainty, for gender re-assignment programs, and for social gender status

binding.name: ConformanceResourceStatus
binding.definition: The lifecycle status of a Value Set or Concept Map

code.definition: This resource is still under development
This resource is ready for normal use
This resource has been withdrawn or superceded and should no longer be used

binding.name: ConformanceUseContext
binding.definition: Indicates the countries, regions, disciplines and other aspects of use this artifact is targeted for use within

binding.name: DataAbsentReason
binding.definition: Used to specify why the normally expected content of the data element is missing

code.definition: The value is not known
The source human does not know the value
There is reason to expect (from the workflow) that the value may become known
The workflow didn't lead to this value being known
The information is not available due to security, privacy or related reasons
code.comment: Using "masked" may be breach of security or confidentiality, but there are times when its use is required to support alternate workflows for gaining access to denied information.

code.definition: The source system wasn't capable of supporting this element
The content of the data is represented in the resource narrative
code.comment: it may be linked by internal references (e.g. xml:id). This usually implies that the value could not be represented in the correct format - this may be due to system limitations, or this particular data value

code.definition: Some system or workflow process error means that the information is not available

binding.name: DataType
binding.definition: The type of an element - one of the FHIR data types

binding.name: FHIRDefinedType
binding.definition: Either a resource or a data type

binding.name: MaritalStatus
binding.definition: The domestic partnership status of a person

binding.name: MessageEvent
binding.definition: One of the message events defined as part of FHIR

binding.name: ResourceType
binding.definition: One of the resource types defined as part of FHIR

binding.name: SpecialValues
binding.definition: A set of generally useful codes defined so they can be included in value sets

code.definition: Boolean true
Boolean false
The content is greater than zero, but too small to be quantified
The specific quantity is not known, but is known to be non-zero and is not specified because it makes up the bulk of the material
code.comment: used in formulations (e.g. 'Add 10mg of ingredient X, 50mg of ingredient Y, and sufficient quantity of water to 100mL.' This code would be used to express the quantity of water. )

code.definition: The value is no longer available
The are no known applicable values in this context
code.comment: The existence of this subject to review

binding.description: List of all supported FHIR Resources
binding.definition: List of all supported FHIR Resources

event.definition: Provide a simple observation or update a previously provided simple observation.
Indicates that a medication has been recorded against the patient's record.
Notification that two patient records actually identify the same patient.
Notification of a change to an administrative resource (either create or update). Note that there is no delete, though some administrative resources have status or period elements for this use.
Change the status of a Medication Administration to show that it is complete.
The definition of a value set is used to create a simple collection of codes suitable for use for data entry or validation. An expanded value set will be returned, or an error message.
Someone wishes to record that the record of administration of a medication is in error and should be ignored.
Provide a diagnostic report, or update a previously provided diagnostic report.
Notification that previous advice that two patient records concern the same patient is now considered incorrect.

annotations.definition: A whole number
annotations.comment: 32 bit number; for values larger than this, use decimal

annotations.definition: A date, date-time or partial date (e.g. just year or year + month). If hours and minutes are specified, a time zone SHALL be populated. The format is a union of the schema types gYear, gYearMonth, date and dateTime. Seconds must be provided due to schema type constraints but may be zero-filled and may be ignored. Dates SHALL be valid dates.
A string which has at least one character and no leading or trailing whitespace and where there is no whitespace other than single spaces in the contents
A date, or partial date (e.g. just year or year + month). There is no time zone. The format is a union of the schema types gYear, gYearMonth and date. Dates SHALL be valid dates.
A rational number with implicit precision
annotations.comment: Do not use a IEEE type floating point type, instead use something that works like a true decimal, with inbuilt precision (e.g. Java BigInteger)

annotations.definition: String of characters used to identify a name or a resource
annotations.comment: see http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Uniform_resource_identifier

annotations.definition: Any combination of lowercase letters, numerals, "-" and ".", with a length limit of 36 characters. (This might be an integer, an unprefixed OID, UUID or any other identifier pattern that meets these constraints.) Systems SHALL send ids as lower-case but SHOULD interpret them case-insensitively.
annotations.comment: RFC 4122

annotations.definition: A stream of bytes
annotations.comment: A stream of bytes, base64 encoded

annotations.definition: A time during the day, with no date specified
An oid represented as a URI
annotations.comment: RFC 3001. See also ISO/IEC 8824:1990 €

annotations.definition: A sequence of Unicode characters
annotations.comment: Note that FHIR strings may not exceed 1MB in size

annotations.definition: Value of "true" or "false"
A UUID, represented as a URI
annotations.comment: See The Open Group, CDE 1.1 Remote Procedure Call specification, Appendix A.

annotations.definition: An instant in time - known at least to the second
annotations.comment: Note: For system observed times, not human-reported times (see date and dateTime below). Time zone is always required

annotations.definition: A string of xhtml data, with a <div> as root
annotations.comment: Can contain only the basic html formatting elements described in chapters 7-11 (except section 4 of chapter 9) and 15 of the HTML 4.0 standard, <a> elements (either name or href), images, and internally contained style attributes.
